name: Combi-Tool
description: Ubiquitous among the Adeptus Mechanicus, these versatile devices are the right tool for virtually every technical job.
effect: Ignore DN penalties to build, repair, maintain, and sabotage Imperial technology.

name: Vox Bead
description: Small enough to fit comfortably in an ear canal and sensitive enough to pick up the wearer's voice, operatives often use these devices to communicate in whispers over distances to coordinate actions.
effect: Communicate with anyone within 1 kilometre with vox unit tuned to same frequency.

name: Vox Caster
description: A bulging backpack of wireless and radio technologies. Operates over large distances and on multiple wave bands simultaneously.
effect: Communicate with anyone within 100 kilometres with a vox unit.

name: Medikit
description: Packed with analgesics, cataplasm patches, and cauterisers. Contains just enough medical accoutrements to mean the difference between life and death.
effect: Make Medicae (Int) Tests to perform surgeries and heal others without DN penalty, including restoring Shock.

name: Stimm
description: A cocktail of high-tech combat drugs, often stored in a single-use injector.
effect: Can be used as part of a Medicae (Int) Test to restore 1d3 + 3 Shock.

name: Chirurgeon's Tools
description: Sacred unguents, surgical tools, sterilisers, and analgesic alembics. Issued to Sisters Hospitaller.
effect: Functions as Medikit. +2 bonus dice to Medicae (Int) Tests when character is Dying.

name: Auspex
description: A versatile handheld scanner that can detect numerous phenomena with high degree of accuracy.
effect: Activated as Combat Action to detect energy emissions, motion, and life signs within 50 metres.

name: Data-Slate
description: Common throughout the Imperium. The simple cogitation engine can hold wealth of information.
effect: Record any information transferable from a cogitator, such as local maps, familial records, or manufactorum outputs.

name: Grav-Chute
description: A backpack sized anti-gravitic device that can control a fall from nearly any height, including sub-orbital altitudes. It allows Imperial troops to float safely to a landing on a column of anti-gravitic force. A grav-chute emits a suspensor field that counters the force of gravity at the particle level, and two small promethium-fuelled thrusters to provide some directional control.
effect: Hover or control a fall for up to one hour. Recharge solar battery by leaving in sunlight for one hour.

name: Jump Pack
description: Gyro-stabilised rockets blast the user high into the air with enough forward momentum to swoop down upon an unwary target.
effect: Using your Movement, you can fly at double your Speed by making a DN3 Pilot (A) Test, ignoring any terrain. If you fail the Pilot (A) Test, your movement deviates according to the Scattering (p.186) rules. A Complication triggers a crash, which deals a minimum of 1d3 Shock, plus falling damage(p.201).

name: Cameleoline Cloak
description: Woven from photo-reactive mimic fibres, the shifting colours blur the outline of the wearer.
effect: +1 bonus die to Stealth (A) Tests and +1 to Defence when in shadow or cover.

name: Preysense Goggles
description: The thermo-sensitive technology within these goggles grants the wearer the ability to see heat signatures even in the dark.
effect: Ignore any penalties to Tests due to visual conditions.

name: Respirator
description: Uses replaceable oxygen canisters and internal breath recyclers to protect from hostile atmospheres and toxic gasses.
effect: Canister lasts 2 hours continuous breathing. Immune to breathable poisons and toxic atmospheres while using.

name: Void Suit
description: Protects wearer from rigors of low atmospheric pressure, solar radiation, and hard vacuum.
effect: Protects from vacuum of space with enough oxygen for five hours continuous use. Includes Vox Caster.

name: Auto-Quill
description: Often said to be the true weapon of the scribe, the arcane inner workings of an Auto-Quill can quickly and accurately copy, produce, or forge documents.
effect: +2 bonus dice to Tests to forge or alter documents.

name: Symbol of Authority
description: A badge, ring, seal, rosette, amulet or otherwise to indicate that the bearer should be taken seriously by those familiar with the hierarchy of their culture.
effect: +1 bonus die to Leadership (Wil) and Intimidation (Wil) Tests versus targets who would respect your position.

name: Chaplet Ecclesiasticus
description: This religious symbol is an Adeptus Ministorum icon hung upon a cord of adamantine beads. Some orders of the Adepta Sororitas place each bead on the cord as a representation of acts of penance.
effect: The Chaplet can be used as a Symbol of Authority (p.240) or, if necessary, a garrote.

name: Psychic Focus
description: These items vary wildly in appearance. Some may take the form of a rod or staff, while others may simply appear to be a 'lucky charm' or a special deck of the Emperor's Tarot.
effect: +1 bonus die to Psychic Mastery (Wil) Tests.

name: Survival Kit
description: This collection of tools helps keep the owner alive in a hostile environment. The kit includes: Compass, Rope, Water, Purification Filters, Chemical Testing Strips
effect: +1 bonus die to all Survival (Wil) Tests.

name: Missionary Kit
description: Travel-ready kit identifying the bearer as a member of the Missionarus Galaxia. Contains sacred texts of the Imperial Creed, holy icon, incense, portable hymn-caster, and liturgical pamphlets.
effect: +1 bonus die to Persuasion (Fel) Tests made involving converts to the Imperial Creed and those seeking redemption through the grace of the God-Emperor.

name: Grooming Kit
description: Standard issue grooming supplies for maintaining personal hygiene in the field.
effect: Basic hygiene maintenance.

name: Ministorum Robes
description: Formal robes worn by members of the Adeptus Ministorum, often decorated with Imperial iconography.
effect: Identifies wearer as member of the Adeptus Ministorum.

name: Administratum Robes
description: Formal robes worn by scribes and functionaries of the Administratum.
effect: Identifies wearer as member of the Administratum.

name: Bedroll
description: A simple roll of insulated fabric for sleeping in the field.
effect: Provides basic shelter for rest.

name: Blanket
description: A heavy blanket for warmth.
effect: Provides warmth during rest.

name: Canteen
description: A container for carrying water or other liquids.
effect: Carries water for travel.

name: Gang Colours
description: Distinctive clothing or accessories that identify membership in a particular gang.
effect: Identifies wearer as gang member.

name: Scrolls of Ancient Records
description: Valuable historical documents and records from the Administratum archives.
effect: +1 bonus die to Scholar Tests involving Imperial history.

name: Tattered Robes
description: Worn and ragged clothing typical of the underhive or wasteland dwellers.
effect: Basic clothing.

name: Ripped Clothes
description: Torn and battered garments, typical Ork attire.
effect: Basic clothing.

name: Rags
description: Little more than strips of cloth barely covering the wearer.
effect: Minimal clothing.

name: Clothing (Common)
description: Simple, everyday clothing.
effect: Basic clothing.

name: Clothing (Uncommon)
description: Well-made clothing of decent quality.
effect: Basic clothing.

name: Clothing (Rare)
description: High-quality or distinctive clothing.
effect: Basic clothing.

name: Clothing (Very Rare)
description: Exceptionally fine or exotic clothing.
effect: Basic clothing.

name: Ration Packs
description: Filling if unappetising, the bars, bricks, powders, and pastes in a standard Ration Pack contain enough nutriment to feed an adult Human for one day.

name: Munitorum-Issue Mess Kit
description: This compact kit unpacks into a bowl, plate, micro-stove, canteen, and full set of utensils, allowing the user to reheat ration packs or cook simple meals from ingredients scavenged in the field. A mess kit also contains a week's worth of ration packs and water purification tablets.
effect: +1 bonus die to Survival (Wil) tests to find food and water.

name: Uplifting Primer
description: The Imperial Infantryman's Uplifting Primer has proven a stalwart mandatory companion for every member of the Astra Militarum. The book covers diverse topics such as arms and equipment maintenance, personal hygiene, rules and regulations of the Astra Militarum, and enemy recognition. Updated when possible as new information is discovered or corrected by frantic margin-scribbling, each Primer is a living document and a part of its owner.
effect: +1 bonus die to Scholar (Int) Test. Complication means user learns potentially dangerous misinformation.

name: Chrono
description: Small timepiece worn strapped to wrist or held in hand.
effect: Accurate tracking of Imperial standard, shipboard, and local planetary time.

name: Spirit Stone
description: These egg-sized psycho-reactive stones are central to Aeldari history and culture. At the moment of death, the stone absorbs and protects an Aeldari's psychic essence from the ever-hungry Slaanesh. The spirit within the stone can be tapped for wisdom by an Infinity Circuit or used to animate the imposing Wraithguard and Wraithlord constructs.
effect: If Aeldari dies while wearing Spirit Stone, stone immediately absorbs soul and stores safely inside.

name: Wraithbone Runes
description: Psychically resonant wraithbone symbols used by Aeldari Warlocks to focus their powers.
effect: +1 bonus die to Psychic Mastery (Wil) Tests for Runes of Battle powers.

name: Frag Grenades
description: Standard anti-personnel fragmentation grenades.
effect: Damage 10, ED 4, Blast (6). Refer to weapon entry frag_grenade for full stats.

name: Krak Grenades
description: Anti-armour shaped charge grenades.
effect: Damage 14, ED 5, AP -2, Blast (4). Refer to weapon entry krak_grenade for full stats.

name: Plasma Grenades
description: Terrifying potential in a small package, a Plasma Grenade is little more than a miniaturised plasma manifold rigged to violently overheat on command. The resulting ball of untethered annihilation is enough to make anyone think twice about even carrying these unstable grenades.
effect: [AI-Generated] Blast (Medium), 14+2ED damage, AP -2.

name: Stikkbombs
description: Crude but effective Ork grenades.
effect: Damage 9, ED 5, Blast (6). Refer to Ork Ranged Weapons table for full stats.

name: Mechadendrite
description: Artificial limbs protruding from mount grafted to spine. Adeptus Mechanicus make extensive use.
effect: Various functions depending on type (ballistic, exploration, medicae, optical).

name: Augmetic Arm
description: Joints and muscles are replaced with flexible cables and servomotors for greater speed and strength.
effect: Gain +1 Strength per Augmetic Arm.

name: Augmetic Eye
description: Several patterns available, all able to vastly expand visual perception.
effect: Select one enhancement: auger, night vision, pict recorder, reticule, or telescopic.

name: Augmetic Legs
description: Metal supports and hydraulic actuators replace bone and sinew, empowering jumps and running.
effect: Gain +2 Speed and add 2 metres to any jump.

name: Banshee Mask
description: The shriek of a Howling Banshee is enhanced by psychosonic amplifiers, paralysing enemies with fear.
effect: When a Howling Banshee Charges, they may make an Interaction Attack using Intimidate as a Free Action.

name: Beastmaster Mask
description: Drukhari Beastmasters wear shamanic masks, often fashioned from the skull or chitinous shell of a deadly creature. They incorporate sub-vocal emitters and pheromone projectors designed to intimidate the creatures they drive into battle.
effect: Causes Fear in creatures with the BEAST Keyword within 20m. They can roll Resolve against a DN of the Beastmaster's Rank to resist.

name: Ghosthelm
description: Wraithbone helm using complex circuitry to conceal the user's Warp presence.
effect: Wearer never rolls on the Perils of the Warp table, and must make Psychic Mastery Tests at Unbound or Transcendent Power Levels.

name: Lodestar Helm
description: Helm that harnesses the protective shades of spirit stones to conceal Warp presence.
effect: Wearer never rolls on the Perils of the Warp table, and must make Psychic Mastery Tests at Unbound or Transcendent Power Levels.

name: Harlequin Mask
description: Mask representing a figure of Aeldari legend, with features that shift at mental command to assume any face or colour.
effect: Whenever an enemy becomes Engaged with a Harlequin, they must make a DN 3 Fear Test.

name: Mandiblasters
description: Pair of miniature laser weapons built into a Striking Scorpion's helmet, psychically triggered.
effect: If a Striking Scorpion rolls a Wrath Critical on a melee attack Test against a creature Size Average or smaller, the target suffers 3 Mortal Wounds in addition to the Critical Hit's effects.

name: Mirror Mask
description: Glassy smooth and featureless Shadowseer mask with shifting iridescent colours that sow doubt and confusion.
effect: All Tests made against a Shadowseer take a dice penalty equal to the Shadowseer's Rank -1.

name: Rictus Mask
description: Macabre Death Jester panoply rumoured to incorporate the bones of their predecessor.
effect: Any character attempting to move into Engagement with a Harlequin wearing a Rictus Mask must pass a Fear Test with a DN equal to 1 + twice the Harlequin's Rank.

name: Spirit Mask
description: Spiritseer mask that aids in channelling abilities to guide Wraith Constructs piloted by the souls of the dead.
effect: WRAITH CONSTRUCT allies within 5m of a Spiritseer gain +3 ED when inflicting Damage.

name: Tormentor
description: To earn a Tormentor, an aspiring Incubus must first kill an Aspect Warrior in single combat. Their slain opponent's spirit stone is shattered and reconstructed into a torture device. The soul's torment is released in a blast of terror that stops enemies in their tracks, allowing the Incubus to slaughter them at leisure. Unsurprisingly, Asuryani especially despise Incubi, even if circumstances require they become temporary allies.
effect: Once per encounter, an Incubus may activate their Tormentor. All enemies within 10m must pass a Resolve Test at a DN of the Incubus' Rank or become Terrified.

name: Anti-Grav Platform
description: Floating platform for mounting heavy weapons.
effect: Weapons with a Heavy (X) Trait may be mounted on these platforms. This removes the Heavy Trait, but the weapon requires an Aeldari within arm's reach to move, and that Aeldari cannot Sprint.

name: Anti-Gravitic Suspensor Crystal
description: Small device ranging from a single wraithbone crystal to a complex lattice of anti-grav repulsors.
effect: When integrated into Aeldari armour (or bodies), lets the user Fly at their base Speed. When integrated into a weapon with the Heavy (X) Trait, the Strength requirement is halved. No more than 1 may be used this way.

name: Arena Trophy
description: Memento from a particularly satisfying kill, such as a Human or T'au skull.
effect: Choose the Faction it came from. The Drukhari causes Fear (3) in any other character within 20m that shares one or more Keywords with the Arena Trophy.

name: Aspect Shrine
description: Symbolic relic of an Aspect Warrior's shrine including a meditative wraithbone icon styled as a rune significant to the Aspect.
effect: May be used during a Regroup or Respite. Gain Rank in bonus dice for a single Test relevant to the Aspect (including attack rolls). Cannot be used again until another Regroup or Respite.

name: Blink Pack
description: Warp Spider jump generator allowing movement through the Warp.
effect: Make a DN 3 Pilot (A) Test to increase Speed to 12 when moving, moving horizontally through other characters and ignoring terrain penalties. Failure causes movement to deviate. A Complication triggers a roll on Perils of the Warp table.

name: Bonesinger Shard
description: Ivory-coloured shards of wraithbone used by Bonesingers to alter or create wraithbone items.
effect: Bonesingers with a Shard ignore DN penalties for any Tests to build, upgrade, maintain, or destroy Aeldari technology.

name: Chains, Blades, and Hooks
description: Embellishments for Kabalite Warrior suits making them more intimidating and dangerous in melee.
effect: May be purchased up to 3 times. Each purchase choose: Chains (use as Whip, +1 to Grapple attacks), Blades (successful melee attacks inflict 1 Bleeding Condition), or Hooks (all attempts to grapple the Drukhari increase DN by 1).

name: Channeller Stones
description: Lost spirit stones that Soul Weavers commune with, borrowing power from the inhabitant.
effect: Once per Turn, the Soul Weaver may reduce the Damage rating of a successful attack to 0. This applies only to the weapon's Damage characteristic, not ED and Shifted Icons.

name: Flip-Belt
description: Miniature anti-grav devices allowing Harlequins to perform incredible acrobatics.
effect: Wearer ignores terrain penalties during movement. May move past enemies without Engaging or provoking Reflexive attacks (still provokes if already Engaged). May substitute Agility for Toughness when rolling Determination.

name: Haemonculus Tools
description: Array of tools permanently grafted onto a Haemonculus's body including stimulants, hormones, mutagens, and incomprehensible devices.
effect: Count as a pair of Mono-Knives that cannot be disarmed. May include any 3 of: Chirurgeon's Tools, Combi-Tool, Diagnositor, Medkit with Vat-Grown replacements, Mutagens (forces Mutation Test), or 5 doses of any Combat Drug/Poison. May change items during Respite.

name: Hunting Trophy
description: Trophy from breaking fierce creatures, such as a giant fang or beast hide, declaring strength and respect.
effect: Grants bonus dice to all Intimidation (WP) Tests made against NPCs: Adversary NPCs - wins ties; Elite NPCs - +1 die; Troop NPCs - +2 dice.

name: Initiation Brand
description: Branding tool bearing an Archon's personal sigil that glows red hot instantly when activated.
effect: An Archon adds their Rank in dice to any social Test against Drukhari sharing the Archon's KABAL Keyword. In combat it acts as a Shock Maul.

name: Initiation Token
description: Varied tokens reminding Kabalites that their comrades are nothing but stepping stones.
effect: When taking damage, the owner may instead choose another character with the same KABAL Keyword to take the hit. The new target must be within the owner's move distance.

name: Rangefinder
description: Advanced sensor arrays resembling a Magnocular Scope with results displaying to HUD or weapon scope.
effect: Combines Magnocular Scope and Preysense Goggles. When used to mark a target (Full-Round Action in combat), provides +2 bonus to all ranged attack Tests against that target, eliminating penalties due to range and environmental conditions.

name: Resonator Shard
description: Wraithbone spikes that attach easily to most surfaces, allowing attuned Aeldari to instinctively know their location.
effect: Heavy weapons with a Blast rating may target the shard, rolling twice and picking the best result. More precise weapons gain no benefit unless the Shard is attached directly to the target.

name: Ritual Tools
description: Specialised tools for Aeldari Path rituals to help balance on the razor's edge of their journey.
effect: May be used during a Regroup to remove 1d3+1 Shock. During a Respite or extended non-combat scene, may focus mind on a particular task, adding Rank in bonus dice to a single Path-relevant Test.

name: Shrine of the Father
description: Obsidian shrine for Incubi to practise their murderous arts, featuring an iron statue of Khaine.
effect: May be used during a Regroup or Respite to contemplate the killing strike. The next successful attack adds Rank in ED.

name: Spirit Stone (Inhabited)
description: Ynnari, empowered by death, have a unique rapport with spirit stone inhabitants. While most spirit stones find their way back to a craftworld's Infinity Circuit, some elect to 'accompany' an Ynnari for a time, offering wisdom, protection, and aid in battle.
effect: Once per session, an Ynnari Agent may call upon an inhabited Spirit Stone for aid, granting them either +1 Defence in combat, or +2 to a single Skill. This lasts for 1 combat encounter or scene, as appropriate.

name: Skyboard
description: Skyboards are single-pilot anti-grav platforms of exceptional agility and speed.
effect: When mounted, the user can Fly at Speed 12 and fire the board's Splinter Pods. If the user rolls a Complication, their Skyboard becomes damaged. A DN 3 Pilot (A) Test is required to stabilise the device â€” if failed, it crashes to the ground, inflicting d3 Shock and an amount of falling Damage appropriate to the distance fallen.

name: Swooping Hawk Wings
description: Jump packs consisting of vibrating metallic feathers and miniature anti-grav projectors that become a dazzling sight when activated.
effect: The wearer can Fly at double their Speed, as per the Jump Pack rules.

name: Terms of Covenant
description: Standard contract for Scourges and Incubi stipulating services, payment, duration, and severe penalties for breach.
effect: When an Incubus or Scourge takes a contract, replace their BLADES FOR HIRE Keyword with the employer's Keyword. If Terms are broken, Commorragh grants the aggrieved party leeway in exacting revenge. Cannot use if already have a faction Keyword.

name: Adrenalight
description: Hyper-engineered adrenaline and aggression enhancers drive the user to leap into melee and fight with ferocious savagery, heedless of their defence.
effect: When the user makes a Charge or All-Out Attack Action, they make two attack rolls. Both rolls receive the bonus dice. Standard dose lasts 4 Rounds.

name: Grave Lotus
description: Powerful muscle stimulants give the user enhanced strength for the duration.
effect: Until it wears off, the user adds +2 to their Strength Attribute and any Tests based on Strength. Standard dose lasts 4 Rounds.

name: Hypex
description: A cocktail of stimulants at concentrations near lethal levels for most Drukhari, Hypex boosts agility and coordination, providing users an astonishing burst of speed.
effect: For the duration, the user adds +4 to their Speed rating. Standard dose lasts 4 Rounds.

name: Painbringer
description: With specialised inhibitors modifying pain receptors and tailored hormones causing increased collagen production in the skin, Painbringer users are tougher and more pain-resistant.
effect: For the duration, the user gains +1 Resilience. Standard dose lasts 4 Rounds.

name: Serpentin
description: A suite of personally tailored artisanal stimulants improve short range hand-eye coordination, reflexes, and agility in combat.
effect: For the duration, the user receives +2 to their Weapon Skill. If used by an Aeldari other than the one it was designed for, benefits are halved. Standard dose lasts 4 Rounds.

name: Splintermind
description: These specialised neurotransmitter supplements provide a large boost to long range perception and hand-eye coordination, and reduce muscle tremors. Ranged combat is boosted significantly, with the added benefit of making the user appear calmer under pressure to others.
effect: For the duration, the user receives +2 Ballistic Skill and Leadership. Each dose must be tailored to the specific user, has no effect on anyone else. Standard dose lasts 4 Rounds.

name: Sororitas Vestments
description: Formal robes and vestments worn by the Adepta Sororitas, often decorated with devotional iconography and Imperial imagery.
effect: Identifies wearer as member of the Adepta Sororitas.

name: Rule of the Sororitas
description: This small book details the traditions and beliefs of the Adepta Sororitas. Many customise the books to reflect the individual nature of their Sororitas Order.
effect: If you have the ADEPTA SORORITAS Keyword, you can read the Rule of Sororitas as part of a Regroup to recover 1d3 Shock.

name: Purity Seal
description: The prayers and litanies of the Imperial Cult are written on simple vellum, then sealed with wax onto the holy weapons and armour of His warriors. These purity seals are awarded to heroic warriors and the purest of the faithful, protecting their bearer from the foul taint of Chaos.
effect: As long as you do not have any points of Corruption, you gain +1 bonus dice to any Corruption Test for each Purity Seal you have.

name: Writing Kit
description: This satchel contains inks, quills, parchment, and other tools necessary to craft a missive on scrolls.
effect: Contains materials for writing and correspondence.

name: Magnocular Scope
description: This advanced arrangement of lenses and prisms functions as both a rangefinder and visual aid, and can be easily attached and detached from most firearms.
effect: Awareness (Int) Tests made with a Magnocular Scope suffer no penalties due to distance. When a Magnocular Scope is attached to a weapon, all Range penalties are reduced by -2.

name: Laud-Hailer
description: Using modified vox technology, a Laud-Hailer can amplify a voice to make it audible to an entire crowd.
effect: A portable Laud-Hailer makes your voice audible at double the normal range. If you have a Talent or Ability that uses your voice, its range is doubled.

name: Excruciator
description: Hundreds of wires labelled with the inscrutable hexagrammic symbols of the Inquisition protrude from this compact black cube...
effect: You may apply an Excrutiator to a target as a Combat Action. If the target is capable of resisting and chooses to do so, you must succeed on an Opposed Test (typically Strength, Agility or Initiative) to inflict the Excrutiator on them. The Excrutiator deals 1 Shock Damage and Hindered 1 when applied to a target. The Excrutiator may be applied repeatedly, dealing an additional 1 Shock Damage and increasing the Hindered Condition by +1 every time it is used. At the GM's discretion, it may also alter the target's emotions.

name: Psychic Hood
description: Often incorporated into an Astartes Librarian's power armour, a Psychic Hood is wired directly into the masterful mind of its wearer. Utilising arcane psychoactive crystalline technology, the Psychic Hood enhances the wearer's ability to exert their influence over the Warp without exposing unduly them to its myriad evils, even improving their ability to nullify the warpcraft of others.
effect: +1 bonus dice to Psychic Master (Wil) Tests...

name: Skull Helm
description: The leering Skull Helm of a Chaplain is a fearsome memento mori, striking fear into the hearts of the hapless enemies of the Adeptus Astartes and reminding those faithful to the Imperium of both the Emperor's divine sacrifice and their own mortality owed to Him.
effect: Whilst wearing a Skull Helm you gain +1 Bonus Dice to all Leadership (Wil) Tests made against targets with the ADEPTUS ASTARTES Keyword.

name: Narthecium
description: [AI-Generated] A sophisticated medical device used by Space Marine Apothecaries. Most Nartheciums incorporate a Reductor, which allows gene-seed to be recovered from a dead Astartes.
effect: You can make Medicae (Int) Tests to perform surgeries and heal others without suffering any DN penalties related to the current situation. When you make a Medicae (Int) Test using a Narthecium as part of a Multi-Action in combat, the DN penalty is decreased by 2. Most Nartheciums incorporate a Reductor, which allows gene-seed to be recovered from a dead Astartes with a Simple Action.

name: Reductor
description: [AI-Generated] A specialized surgical tool used by Space Marine Apothecaries to extract the progenoid glands (gene-seed) from fallen battle-brothers.
effect: [AI-Generated] Allows gene-seed to be recovered from a dead Astartes with a Simple Action.

name: Simulacrum Imperialis
description: Often incorporating the bones of saints or carved statues of their hallowed likeness, a Simulacrum Imperialis is held aloft over the field of battle, inspiring the devout to feats of heroism.
effect: As long as you heft the Simulacrum Imperialis with at least one hand, you and any allies that are faithful to the Imperial Cult within 15 metres gain +2 Bonus Dice to any Corruption Tests.

name: Diagnostor Helmet
description: The auto-senses installed in a suit of Astartes Power Armour are perfectly optimised for battle, but those worn by Apothecaries are retuned to focus on medical aid.
effect: +1 Bonus Dice to Medicae (Int) Tests to detect and diagnose diseases, injuries, and ailments, and to determine cause of death. If your target is the Adeptus Astartes or Primaris Astartes Species, this bonus increases to +2 Bonus Dice.

name: Sacred Machine Oil
description: Blessed by the Omnissiah, this oil has considerable value to the Adeptus Mechanicus. It is said that this oil has properties to soothe an agitated machine spirit.
effect: You can choose to ignore a single Complication involving Imperial technology in any scene.

name: Adept Robes
description: Red robes worn by members of the Adeptus Mechanicus, signifying their devotion to the Machine God.
effect: Identifies wearer as member of the Adeptus Mechanicus.

name: Servo-Harness
description: [AI-Generated] A complex array of servo-arms, cutters, and other tools mounted on a harness worn by Techmarines. In battle, it can be adapted to wield bolters and flamers.
effect: [AI-Generated] Provides multiple servo-arms for engineering and combat tasks. Allows the wearer to perform repairs while engaging enemies.

name: Astartes Servo-Arm
description: [AI-Generated] A powerful mechanical appendage that combines the strength of the Machine Spirit with blessed unguents.
effect: You gain +5 Strength when using the Astartes Servo-Arm. The arm allows you to Brace (Wrath & Glory Core Rulebook, page 189) as a Free Action in combat. It adds +1 bonus dice to all Tech (Int) Tests to perform engineering tasks, and can be used to make unarmed strikes with the servo-arm's Strength.

name: Company Standard
description: [AI-Generated] A sacred banner bearing the heraldry of a Space Marine Company, carried into battle by the Company Ancient.
effect: [AI-Generated] Inspires nearby allies. Functions as a Symbol of Authority for ADEPTUS ASTARTES.

name: Smoke Grenades
description: [AI-Generated] Grenades that release thick smoke to obscure vision and provide concealment.
effect: [AI-Generated] Creates a smoke cloud that blocks line of sight in a Medium Blast area for several rounds.

name: Shock Grenades
description: [AI-Generated] Non-lethal grenades that emit a blinding flash and deafening sound to disorient targets.
effect: [AI-Generated] Blast (Medium), targets must pass a Toughness Test or be Stunned.

name: Haywire Mine
description: [AI-Generated] An electromagnetic pulse mine designed to disable vehicles and mechanical targets.
effect: [AI-Generated] When triggered, releases an EMP that damages and disables machines and vehicles in the area.

name: Combat Drugs
description: [AI-Generated] A collection of performance-enhancing substances used by Drukhari warriors to heighten their abilities in battle.
effect: [AI-Generated] Roll or choose from the combat drug table to gain various combat bonuses. Standard dose lasts 4 Rounds.

name: Fine Clothing
description: Expensive, well-made garments befitting a person of wealth and status.
effect: +1 bonus die to social Tests when appearance matters.

name: Warrant of Trade
description: A legal document that empowers a Rogue Trader to explore, conquer, and trade beyond the boundaries of the Imperium. Each Warrant of Trade is unique, stipulating the freedoms and limitations it confers.
effect: Grants authority to operate outside normal Imperial jurisdiction. Provides legitimacy when dealing with Imperial organizations.

name: Disguise Kit
description: A collection of wigs, makeup, prosthetics, and other materials for altering one's appearance.
effect: +2 bonus dice to Deception (Fel) Tests when creating or maintaining a disguise.

name: Commissar Greatcoat
description: The distinctive long coat worn by Imperial Commissars, often adorned with medals and insignia of rank.
effect: Identifies wearer as an Imperial Commissar. Functions as a Symbol of Authority with the ASTRA MILITARUM Keyword.

name: Omnissian Sigil
description: A sacred symbol of the Adeptus Mechanicus, often worn as a pendant or displayed prominently.
effect: Identifies bearer as a member of the Adeptus Mechanicus. Functions as a Symbol of Authority with the ADEPTUS MECHANICUS Keyword.

name: Inquisitorial Rosette
description: The symbol of the Inquisition, this ornate badge grants its bearer vast authority throughout the Imperium.
effect: Grants authority to requisition troops, commandeer vessels, and demand cooperation from Imperial organizations. Functions as a Symbol of Authority.

name: Ballistic Autoreliquary
description: [AI-Generated] A sacred container housing blessed bolt shells and relics of the Chapter, carried by Primaris Marines.
effect: [AI-Generated] Provides blessed ammunition for bolt weapons.

name: Hooks and Chains
description: [AI-Generated] Chains, hooks, and blades affixed to Kabalite armor that make them more intimidating and dangerous in melee.
effect: [AI-Generated] May be used as improvised weapons. Can be used in grapples to inflict additional damage.

name: Trophy Rack
description: A macabre collection of trophies from fallen enemies displayed on an Archon's armor.
effect: +1 bonus dice to Intimidation Tests against enemies who share a keyword with any trophy.

name: False Face
description: A psychoactive mask worn by Harlequins that can assume any appearance at the wearer's mental command.
effect: +2 bonus dice to Deception (Fel) Tests involving disguise. Enemies must make a Fear Test when first Engaging a Harlequin.

name: Ichor Injector
description: [AI-Generated] A medical device used by Haemonculi to inject potent substances into their subjects.
effect: [AI-Generated] Can inject toxins, stimulants, or other substances as a Combat Action.

name: Back Banner
description: A personal banner carried on the back of an Autarch, displaying their personal heraldry and honors.
effect: All Aeldari allies within 20m gain +1 bonus dice to Leadership (Wil) Tests.

name: Grenade Pack
description: A bandolier of plasma grenades carried by Swooping Hawks, designed to be dropped on enemies during swooping attacks.
effect: Can drop grenades on enemies during flight. Contains plasma grenades.

name: Warp Spider Jump Generator
description: A miniature Warp engine allowing Warp Spiders to teleport short distances through the Immaterium.
effect: Make a DN 3 Pilot (A) Test to increase Speed to 12, moving through other characters and ignoring terrain. Failure causes deviation. A Complication triggers a roll on Perils of the Warp.

name: Infiltrator Headpiece
description: Originally designed to amplify the neurostatic aura of a Sicarian Infiltrator, the auto-senses of these domed headpieces are prized amongst scouts and sentries for extending their vision across multiple spectra.
effect: Your Passive Awareness is increased by +Rank.

name: Fusion Charges
description: Melta-based demolition charges carried by Fire Dragons for breaching fortifications.
effect: Can be placed as demolition charges. 16+4 ED damage, AP -4, Melta, Blast (Small).

name: Howling Banshee Mask
description: A helmet with psychosonic amplifiers that emit a terrifying shriek to paralyse enemies with fear.
effect: When a Howling Banshee Charges, they may make an Intimidation Interaction Attack as a Free Action.

name: Mandiblaster
description: A pair of miniature laser weapons built into a Striking Scorpion's helmet, psychically triggered.
effect: If a Striking Scorpion rolls a Wrath Critical on a melee attack Test against a creature Size Average or smaller, the target suffers 3 Mortal Wounds in addition to the Critical Hit's effects.

name: Null Rod
description: Forged from inscrutable obsidian, a Null Rod has the highly prized ability to limit the insidious influence of the Warp in a small area.
effect: Whilst you wield a Null Rod in one hand, any Psychic Mastery (Wil) Tests made within 18 metres of you suffer a DN penalty of +3.

name: Augmetics
description: A general category of cybernetic enhancements common in the Imperium.
effect: Varies depending on specific augmetic chosen.

name: Apertor (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These devices contain an assortment of dictum-spirits and command algorithms that can override most common locking mechanisms.
effect: When you attempt a Tech test to override a door or other technological lock, you add +3 bonus dice to your dice pool.

name: Auspectre (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Auspectre is an advanced piece of Imperial equipment utilized by the Vanus Temple of the Officio Assassinorum. These devices are used by Vanus Infocytes to process a bewildering amount of battlefield data in real-time, detecting the arrival and location of enemy troops and even temporarily over-riding their systems to take control of weapons targeting and control hardware.
effect: You may activate an Auspectre as a Simple Action to detect energy emissions, motion, and other life signs within 150 metres.

name: Auto-Chastiser (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: This compact device, worn beneath clothing and armour, connects to the nervous system and monitors their mental state. The device's machine spirit is tuned to respond to the wearer's own feelings of failure, punishing inadequacy with corrective spikes of pain.
effect: While wearing an Auto-Chastiser, you may re-roll any dice on a skill test which roll 1s. However, any dice which you re-roll which still results in a 1 inflicts 1 Shock.

name: Book of Judgement (Abridged) (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Book of Judgement is the legal code of the Imperium, enforced by the Adeptus Arbites. It has been painstakingly collected over centuries and has long ago spread beyond the confines of a single literal volume as it embodies every decree ever passed by the High Lords of Terra. Its most ancient decrees are written upon parchments of human skin, inscribed in unknown tongues by nameless functionaries of a forgotten age.
effect: Individual Arbitrators routinely carry around concise, abridged volumes. These are not binding legal texts, but serve as a symbol of the Arbitrator's duty, and it is common to read passages from it during an arrest, interrogation, or when passing judgement.

name: Divinator-class Auspex (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These sophisticated forms of auspex provide a remarkable combination of visual and multi-spectral observation-and-analysis technologies, which gather every scrap of data from the wearer's surroundings. With training, this flood of information allows the wearer to fight in an almost precognitive fashion, responding to situations far more swiftly than they would be able to unaided.
effect: A Divinator-class Auspex functions like a normal Auspex in all regards. In addition, when an enemy within 15m moves, the wearer may spend one ammunition to make an immediate ranged attack as a Reflexive Action, at +4 DN, against that enemy.

name: Etherium (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Etherium is a highly advanced form of the same kinds of psychic-resistant technology found in Hexagrammic Wards, Null Rods, and the Aegis-pattern armour worn by the Grey Knights. This, in combination with the Culexus Assassin's innate abilities, is so psychically disruptive that most minds struggle to perceive the assassin, as physical senses and psychic instincts conflict.
effect: You may activate the Etherium as a Simple Action. While active, your Stealth Score cannot ever fall below your Willpower: if ever it would drop below your Willpower, it increases to that level at the start of your next turn.

name: Explosive Collar (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Fitted around a Penal Legionnaire's neck, an explosive collar detonates when triggered remotely, or should it be tampered with. The small, directed charge is more than enough to remove the insubordinate's head, but inflicts only minor collateral damage.
effect: The control for an explosive collar is held by another character, and has a range of 500m. It can be triggered as a Simple Action, killing the wearer instantly.

name: Force Matrix (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Force Matrix consists of a series of psychic conduits which are made of a material like that used in the construction of Force Weapons. When connected to a Culexus Assassin, the Force Matrix gathers excess warp energy drawn upon by nearby psykers, storing it so that it can be used to fuel the assassin's Animus Speculum.
effect: Whenever a PSYKER within 25m of the wearer attempts to use a psychic power (other than Psyniscience or Deny the Witch), the Force Matrix gains a single charge. Charges may be used as Reloads for the Animus Speculum.

name: Grapple Gun (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These devices, appearing like a normal firearm, use gas pressure or magnetic impulse to propel a sturdy metal hook attached to a cable. They're favoured by shock troops fighting in dense terrain, as it allows them to attack from unexpected directions and position themselves in hard-to-reach vantages.
effect: [AI-Generated] Allows rapid ascent and traversal of difficult terrain.

name: Liber Daemonica (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Liber Daemonica is the Grey Knights Chapter's sacred book that contains prayers, battle rituals, litanies, funeral rites, and Chaos lore. Inquisitors of the Ordo Malleus are also known to possess copies of the book. While it may appear to be a normal book, opening it will reveal a series of wafer-screens that contain instructional hololiths and reactive picts which respond to the reader's needs.
effect: A character reading from the Liber Daemonica may add +Rank bonus dice to any Scholar test regarding combating Daemons and their allies. A character who keeps the book on their person and reads from it routinely gains +2 Conviction.

name: Magnacles (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Magnacles are pieces of equipment frequently used by the Adeptus Arbites. These are magnetised handclampsâ€”a snap-open hoop constructed of hardened and tempered steel that seals around a suspect's wrist and locks. They are designed to lock together, but they can also be locked onto any other magnetic surface: suspects mag-locked onto a transport vehicle, or bound to the table in an interrogation cell, or even locked to the armour of the Arbitrator escorting them are all common ways these devices are used.
effect: Breaking free of magnacles' magnetic lock requires a Strength test (DN 5).

name: Narthecium (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Narthecium is a tool of a Space Marine Apothecary's trade, containing implements specially designed for treating the Astartes' genetically engineered physiology and for performing first aid without having to remove the patient's Power Armour. It also comprises various counterseptics, synthderm patches, transfusions and other compounds engineered for the Space Marines' physiology, and several stasis tubes for storing any recovered gene-seed taken from a dead Space Marine's Progenoid Glands.
effect: A Narthecium provides all the means to treat battlefield injuries and perform medical procedures in the field. It also adds +2 bonus dice to Medicae tests to treat the injuries of characters of the Adeptus Astartes or Primaris Astartes species.

name: Oath Parchment (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A tradition said to date back to the Great Crusades, many in the Imperium maintain the practice of swearing an oath to the objectives of their mission. Such oaths are recorded upon parchment scrolls and affixed to armour, and they serve to focus the mind of the wearer upon their duty. They are sometimes mistaken for purity seals, a similar tradition that dates back as far.
effect: After a Respite, you may swear an Oath of Moment, pledging yourself to the completion of a specific objective. If you complete this objective, you gain 1 Wrath point. If you fail in your objective, the GM gains 1 Ruin.

name: Psychic Hood (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Psychic Hood is an arcane device utilised by Space Marine Librarians to amplify the wearer's psychic powers and protect against an assault by enemy psykers. Most importantly, a Psychic Hood renders the wearer more able to counter the effects that other psykers have on the Warp nearby. Distinguished by the trademark metal hood that rises from the backplate of a Librarian's Power Armour, a Psychic Hood uses a set of interwoven, intricately aligned crystals to nullify an opponent's psychic attacks.
effect: A character wearing a psychic hood may attempt to Deny the Witch as a Reflexive Action in response to an enemy PSYKER using a power, though they may not use a psychic power during their following turn. Further, they may add +Double Rank bonus dice on their Psychic Mastery test to use Deny the Witch.

name: Psyocculum (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Resembling an ornate photo-visor, a Psyocculum is designed to detect the psychic emanations of a psyker and render them visible.
effect: The wearer can attempt to use the Psyniscience ability as if they were a PSYKER but using their Awareness instead of Psychic Mastery.

name: Reductor (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Reductor is a special tool used by Adeptus Astartes Apothecaries and Primaris Apothecaries to retrieve the crucial gene-seed of their fallen Battle-Brothers so that new Astartes might be raised from among their Chapter's Aspirants. While a Reductor is not required for Progenoid removal, it significantly reduces the time.
effect: As an action, an Apothecary can use a Reductor to remove the gene-seed of a deceased Space Marine. This requires a Medicae test (DN 3). Though a grim task, it is a vital one, and an Apothecary who extracts a fallen brother's gene-seed gains 1 Wrath immediately.

name: Sainted Reliquiae (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Imperium has a great many saints, and many of the devout take solace and inspiration from the tales of these saints, even carrying tiny reliquiaeâ€”saintly remains, fragments of their preserved bodies or items related to themâ€”to serve as physical reminders and vessels of holy presence.
effect: When you score a Wrath Critical, you may gain 1 Faith Point instead of one Glory point.

name: Sentinel Array (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Connected to an Eversor's mask is a sophisticated collection of augurs, auspexes, and microcogitators which always gather and process readings from the wearer's surroundings. While short-ranged, this still provides the Eversor with a detailed 360Â° view of their immediate environment: they can see in all directions simultaneously, and thus foes cannot try to sneak away.
effect: The Eversor may choose to make a ranged attack or a melee attackâ€”at the assassin's discretionâ€”as a Reflexive Action whenever an enemy tries to move away while engaged, even if those enemies use the Fall Back option to do so.

name: Strobe-Lumen (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These intense lumen-globes, fitted to armour or weapons, can be set to flash and pulse rapidly, creating a disorienting effect. This can be extremely useful during riot control, as disoriented foes are much easier to pacify.
effect: When you attempt an Intimidation Interaction Attack, you may activate your Strobe-Lumen. If you do so, increase the rating of the Hindered or Vulnerable condition you inflict by +2.

name: Vindicare Spy Mask (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Vindicare's mask is a vital tool for their missions. It contains hyper-concentrated nutrient and hydration pellets which allow them to serve without support for long periods, and a multi-channel vox-thief for monitoring enemy communications. However, the main feature is the broad-spectrum visor, which allows the wearer to pick out targets at extreme distances.
effect: The mask renders the wearer immune to penalties due to darkness and fog and allows the wearer to ignore any modifiers to the targets' Defence from being in cover.

name: Vox-Disruptor Array (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These powerful jamming devices can interfere with vox signals and similar forms of communication technology.
effect: When active, vox-casters and similar technological forms of communication cease to function within 50m. As a combat action, you may increase this distance with an DN 3 Tech test; success doubles the range, and each shifted Icon doubles the range again.

name: Adrenaline Shot (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: An additional dose of adrenalineâ€”supplementing that which the body produces naturallyâ€”can help hardened soldiers push past their limits and keep fighting when hurt or tired.
effect: When you take an Adrenaline Shot, you immediately regain 1d3+2 Shock, and ignore the penalties for being Wounded until the end of your next turn. Once you have taken an Adrenaline Shot, you cannot benefit from another until your next Regroup.

name: Barrage (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A particularly nasty stimm not used on a voluntary basis because of its horrendous side effects. It works by bombarding the user with a cocktail of chemicals that power muscle strength, pain resistance and sensory acuity, but at the same time these functions are slowly destroyed by the drugs.
effect: Taking a dose of Barrage adds +3 to Strength, Toughness, and Agility for 1d3+2 rounds (or minutes out of combat). After this effect ends, the character suffers 1d3 Wounds, and is Exhausted until their next Regroup.

name: De-Tox (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A common drug distributed by the Departmento Munitorum and other organisations to those likely to face chemical warfare, poisonous environments, or similar dangers, this drug can negate the effects of most dangerous toxins and poisons if administered quickly.
effect: A dose of de-tox immediately ends the effects of any poison or drug currently in the user's system. However, the effects of this rapid cleansing are debilitating, and the recipient may not take any action during their next turn and are Exhausted until their next Regroup.

name: Eversor Combat Drugs (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: In addition to their extensive biomechanical augmentation, Eversor assassins employ an assortment of potent combat stimulants and augmentative serums which massively heighten their prowess.
effect: At the start of an Eversor's turn, they may use a single dose of one of the following combat drugs as a Free Action: Fury (Speed doubled), Terminus (continue acting when Dying), or Destroyer (additional attacks on kills).

name: Frenzon (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A generic name for an array of combat drugs often administered to penal legionnaires, pit fighters, arco-flagellants, and similar combatants.
effect: A character who takes a dose of frenzon immediately becomes Frenzied. This Frenzied state cannot be resisted for a number of rounds equal to 10 minus the recipient's Toughness score.

name: Halo (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Commonly given to Penal Legionnaires, Halo creates a compliant state suitable for combat prisoner indoctrination. Users can be better readied and even made enthusiastic to meet their coming fate on the battlefield. Other heavily stressed troopers use it to forcibly induce a calmer frame of mind.
effect: Taking a dose of Halo adds +2 to the user's Resolve but reduces the character's Passive Awareness by 1 and adds +2 DN to all Awareness tests. This lasts for 2d6 hours.

name: Kick (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A potent blend of stimulants and neural accelerants, Kick makes the user feel supercharged with energy. It is ideal for short-term assaults, as the effects burn off rapidly, inducing a profound fatigue afterwards.
effect: When a dose is taken, the character recovers all Shock, and recovers 1d3 Shock at the start of every round for 2d6 combat rounds. Once this ends, the character is Exhausted for 1d3+2 hours.

name: Panimune (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: This highly potent medicinal compound serves to greatly enhance resistance to most forms of toxins, contaminants, microorganisms, and infection for several hours, though repeated use can have dangerous side effects.
effect: A dose of Panimune provides +3 bonus dice on all Toughness tests to resist poisons, diseases, and other environmental effects for 1d3+2 hours. After the dose expires, the user is Exhausted until their next Regroup.

name: Polymorphine (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: All the Assassins of the Callidus Temple are trained in the use of Polymorphine. With this specialised drug alone a Callidus Assassin may masquerade as any human being she may choose, from a beautiful young woman to a crippled old man. However, in addition, the Medicae Adepts of the Imperium have developed a range of surgical implants to allow Callidus Assassins to mimic members of alien races, like the Orks and Aeldari.
effect: A Callidus may take a single dose of Polymorphine at the start of a Regroup and spend the following hour adjusting their form in the desired way. A Callidus can take on the appearance of any humanoid creature of Average size.

name: Psychon (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Stimulating the instinctual centres of the brain stem, Psychon works by boosting strength through sudden adrenal rushes. However, it drastically reduces one's ability to make rational decisions.
effect: Taking a dose of Psychon adds +2 to the user's Strength and Toughness and makes them Frenzied for 3d6 rounds (or minutes, out of combat).

name: Reflex (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: This drug heightens reaction time and reflex action, allowing the user to react more quickly to changing circumstances, but it leaves them susceptible to suggestion and psychic attack.
effect: Taking a dose of Reflex adds +2 to the user's Initiative and allows the character to Keep the Initiative without spending Glory but adds +2DN to the difficulty of all Willpower, Resolve, and Conviction Tests. This lasts for 2d6 rounds.

name: Slaught (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Short for 'onslaught', this drug amplifies awareness and reaction time, speeding up the user but taking a nasty toll in the process.
effect: Taking a dose of slaught adds +3 to the user's Agility and Initiative for the next 3d6 rounds (or minutes, out of combat). Once the drug's effects end, the user must pass a Toughness test (DN 3) or add +2 to the DN of all Agility- and Initiative-based tests for the next 1d3+2 hours.

name: Spur (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Spur is a name given to several similar stimulants, which boost the nervous system, muscle reaction, and reflexes for a short time.
effect: Taking a dose of Spur adds +2 to the user's Speed and Initiative for the next 2d6 minutes. Once the drug's effects end, the user must pass a Toughness test (DN 3) or become Exhausted for the next hour.

name: Synth-Skin (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A thin foam sprayed over damaged flesh to staunch bleeding and promote new skin regeneration, synth-skin is a valuable part of any combat medkit.
effect: Synthskin can be applied as a Combat Action, and immediately removes all Bleeding conditions from you or another character within arm's reach.

name: Torpor (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Long-used by the League of Blackships to control their 'cargo', Torpor is a chemical cocktail of neural inhibitors and narcotics designed to render the subject docile and dampen their psychic talents. The Holy Ordos maintain their own supplies of Torpor to control prisoners.
effect: A single dose of Torpor lasts for a number of hours equal to 10 minus the subject's Toughness, during which time the subject counts as Exhausted and Staggered. Further, PSYKERS under the effects of Torpor count their Psychic Mastery rank as 4 less than normal while under the drug's effects.

name: Agaith (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: All Harlequins wear a highly ornamented mask called an Agaith ('false face', in one Aeldari language), which present a gruesome visage. During a performance, these masks display patterns, colours, and features to support the Harlequin's role, but in battle, they take on a darker purpose. Each mask is highly psychoreactive, responding not only to the thoughts of the wearer, but showing a different visage to all who look upon it.
effect: The wearer of an Agaith causes Fear (DN 3 +Rank).

name: Anti-Grav Platform (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The advanced gravity-defying technology on the platforms allows the Eldar to move heavy weapons and other heavy equipment rapidly and effortlessly across the field of battle regardless of terrain.
effect: An Anti-Grav Platform has a Speed of 8 and will automatically attempt to stay within 3m of the operator. It floats about a metre above the ground and will ignore any obstacles or hindrances of that height or smaller. A Heavy weapon mounted on the platform always counts as Braced.

name: Aspect Shrine Banner (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: You bear a small back-banner emblazoned with the colours and sigil of your Aspect Shrine, as a rallying point for your kin.
effect: Allied ASPECT WARRIORS of your Aspect Shrine increase their Resolve and Conviction by +Rank while within 12m of you.

name: Banshee Mask (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Banshee Mask is a war helm worn by the Howling Banshees Eldar Aspect Warriors in battle. Their distinctive design contains psychosonic amplifiers that magnify the keening battle screams of their wearers into mind-destroying shockwaves. This inflicts severe damage to the central nervous system of an Eldar warrior's foe, inspiring a feeling of mortal terror and causing momentary paralysis.
effect: When a Howling Banshee charges, all enemies within 3m of the Banshee's target are paralysed by the war-cry; they cannot perform any Reflexive Actions and suffer the Hindered 2 and Vulnerable 2 conditions.

name: Celestial Shield (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Celestial Shield is a psychically-activated force field technology that is sometimes used by Asuryani Guardians as an emergency personal defence. Once activated, the psychic shield allows the user to withstand attacks for a short time that would otherwise have slain or badly injured them at a key moment during the battle.
effect: You may activate this item as a Reflexive Action when you are the target of a ranged attack. Your Resilience and Determination increases by +2 against ranged attacks until the start of your next turn.

name: Dark Reaper Rangefinder (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Dark Reaper Range Finder is a specialized Eldar targeting system used by Dark Reapers. Composed of a complex array of sensory and range-finding equipment incorporated into the helms of their Aspect Armour and tied directly into their weapon, Dark Reapers can target their enemies swiftly and accurately thanks to this equipment.
effect: The Reaper Rangefinder allows the wearer to see even in complete darkness or through fog with no penalty. In addition, when a Dark Reaper aims before making a ranged attack, they add +3d to their attack.

name: Dread Mask (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These leering masks, an advanced form of Agaith, contain a psychic sensor which detects the greatest fears of those nearby, and projects them back amplified tenfold.
effect: The wearer of a Dread Mask causes Terror (DN 3 +Rank).

name: Flip-Belt (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Flip Belt or Inertia Pivot (known as geirgilath or a 'belt of speed' in the Eldar language) is an item worn exclusively by the mysterious Eldar Harlequins. This device is a wonder of Eldar technology, a portable anti-grav generator keyed to trigger upon the mental command of its wearer.
effect: A character wearing a Flip-Belt ignores the effects of difficult terrain, can ignore any obstacles less than 2m tall or wide during their movement, and may stand up from prone as a free action at any time without penalty.

name: Ghosthelm (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Ghosthelm is an Aeldari device worn by Asuryani Farseers. This helmet, fashioned in the typical Asuryani style, incorporates highly intricate, psychic circuitry crafted from crystal that can mask the presence of the wearer's soul in the Immaterium. This is a crucial protection for potent psykers like the Aeldari, whose souls shine like blazing beacons in the Warp, drawing the attention of daemons and other hostile Warp entities.
effect: Any DAEMON or other warp entity attempting to perceive, attack, or otherwise interact with a Farseer wearing a Ghosthelm suffers a +2DN penalty to any tests they attempt. In addition, the Farseer no longer rolls on the Perils of the Warp table; instead, they suffer 1d3 Shock when they suffer Wrath Complications when using a Psychic Power.

name: Mandiblaster Helm (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Mandiblasters are an Eldar weapon system in the form of pods built into either side of the helmets of Striking Scorpions. Known also as the Scorpion's Sting or the Sting of the Scorpion, Mandiblasters are activated by neural impulses to fire a hail of deadly metallic shards.
effect: When the wearer of a Mandiblaster Helm charges into combat, and at the start of each turn they are engaged in combat, roll 1d6. On an Icon, one enemy within 2m suffers 1d3 Mortal Wounds.

name: Phase Field (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Using the most advanced warp technology available to the Aeldari, a phase field allows the wearer to shift into the veil between realspace and the Webway, 'phasing' in and out of reality.
effect: You may activate the field when you move. When you do so, you have a Speed of 10, but your movement can take you to any point within your movement distance: you vanish and reappear at your destination, without regard for intervening terrain.

name: Rictus Mask (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Rictus Mask, called marathag, or 'face of death' in the Aeldari language, fills those who see it with an almost uncontrollable urge for morbid self-preservation.
effect: The wearer of a Rictus Mask causes Fear (DN 3 +Rank). Further, when the wearer makes an Intimidation Interaction Attack, if the attack is successful, the target is also Pinned as if suppressed by a Salvo 5 weapon.

name: Runes of Warding (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Runes of Warding are special items used by Eldar Farseers. These tiny wraithbone runes allow the Farseer to divine when an enemy psyker is attempting to use his powers and then produce psychic interference strong enough to hinder them.
effect: As a Reflexive Action, when an enemy psyker attempts to use a psychic power within 18m, you may increase the DN of their Psychic Mastery test by +Double Rank.

name: Runes of Witnessing (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Runes of Witnessing are special items used by Eldar Farseers. These runes allow the Farseer to better guide their psychic perceptions along the twisting strands of fate, which improve their psychic abilities, reveals new flows and currents of power, and exposes enemies hidden from their sight.
effect: Once per round, when you attempt to use a psychic power, you may re-roll a number of dice on your Psychic Mastery test equal to Double Rank.

name: Seer's Spirit Stone (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Eldar Farseers often carry the spirit stone of a venerated predecessor or long-dead ancestor. These stones can be a source of wisdom and guidance during times of strife, and a source of power in times of desperation.
effect: When you attempt to use a psychic power, you may draw upon the power of the soul within the stone. This grants one of two effects: either you gain +Double Rank bonus dice on a single Psychic Mastery test, or you may use the psychic power as a Simple Action. Once used, the stone's inhabiting soul goes dormant until the next Respite.

name: Serpent Shield Generator (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These bulky generators are a scaled-down form of the force field generators installed in Wave Serpent grav-tanks. They are deployed on anti-grav platforms accompanying close assault Storm Guardian squads, to protect them from enemy fire while they advance.
effect: While this field is active, all ASURYANI allies within 6m gain +3 to their Resilience against ranged attacks. Further, the field can be discharged as a Combat Action, affecting all enemies in a Blast (6) within 12m of the generator.

name: Swooping Hawk Wings (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Swooping Hawk Wings are specialized Eldar jump packs used exclusively by the Swooping Hawk Aspect Warriors. Composed of vibrating feather plates, these wings combine an anti-gravity lifter with jet propulsion motors to give the Swooping Hawks their impressive flight speed and manoeuvrability.
effect: A warrior wearing Swooping Hawk Wings gains the ability to fly, and a flying speed equal to twice their normal movement speed.

name: Targeting Vane (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Mounted over the shoulder of a Dire Avenger's armour is an advanced targeting system which connects both to the warrior's Avenger Shuriken Catapult and to the warrior's warhelm. This multispectral rangefinder operates autonomously, identifying targets and distinguishing friend from foe, and feeding this information to warrior's visor.
effect: A warrior wearing a Targeting Vane reduces range DN penalties by 2. In addition, if the warrior aims, they add an additional +1d bonus to the following ranged attack.

name: Warp Spider Jump Generator (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Warp Spider Jump Generator is an Eldar teleportation device used by Warp Spider Aspect Warriors housed within the armoured backpack of their armour. This compact and complex device allows for instantaneous travel through the Warp, giving their prey no warning as they appear right beside them.
effect: A warrior wearing a Warp Spider Jump Generator may activate it as a Simple Action. If they do so, then they vanish from the battlefield, and instantly reappear anywhere within 20m. When they reappear, make a Resolve test (DN 3) for the warrior.

name: Wraithbone Talisman (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Wraithbone is a substance used in many forms of Aeldari technology. It is psychoreactive, and is found in many devices and objects which are intended to channel and direct the energies of the Warp. Many Eldar wear charms or talismen of wraithbone, often shaped into symbolic representations of their ancient gods or mythic figures, seeking clarity of thought, focus, or good fortune.
effect: A character wearing a wraithbone talisman may draw upon the talisman as a Free Action to gain 1 Glory. Once a talisman has been used in this way, it cannot be used again until after the next Regroup.

name: Crucible of Malediction (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Haemonculi are known to refer to this bizarre weapon as 'the kin-gift', for it is especially dangerous to their Asuryani cousins. Each crucible contains the essence of psykers captured and tortured until death. When unleashed, their tormented spirits hurtle across the battlefield, unleashing a psychic cacophony that is bane to psykers.
effect: You may activate this as an Action. Each PSYKER within 18m must immediately pass a Conviction test or suffer 3d3 Mortal Wounds. Once used, you cannot use this item again until after your next Regroup.

name: Haemacolyte's Tools (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: This collection of bizarre blades, needles, probes, and syringes are a hallmark of those who serve the Haemonculi Covens. They are tools of fleshcraft, and while they are used to keep people alive, they are used as often to torment people and extract useful secretions from their flesh.
effect: Functions as a Medikit. In addition, against a Restrained target, it may be used to make a Medicae Test (DN = target's Toughness) to inflict 1d3 Shock, +1 Shock per shifted Icon.

name: Haemonculus' Tools (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The eclectic and unique tools of the Flesh-crafter's trade often include a variety of cruel blades and the delivery systems for a variety of bizarre drugs, medicines, and poisons.
effect: Functions as a Medikit. In addition, against a Restrained target, it may be used to make a Medicae Test (DN = target's Toughness) to inflict 1d3 Shock, +1 Shock per shifted Icon. Can also be used as a melee weapon.

name: Hekatarii Combat Drugs (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Though they dramatically reduce the lifespan of any Aeldari that uses them, performance-enhancing combat drugs are commonly used in the gladiatorial arenas of the Hekatarii, as well as by Wyches entering real battle.
effect: The user may administer a single dose as a free action, which will last for about an hour or until the character takes a Regroup. Includes: Adrenalight, Grave Lotus, Hypex, Painbringer, Serpentin, Splintermind.

name: Tormented Soul Stone (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The stolen soul stone of a slain Aeldari is quite a prize within the Dark City, for it is a wellspring of concentrated suffering that can invigorate the withered souls of the Drukhari.
effect: A Wounded Drukhari can draw upon the anguish contained in the stone to immediately recover either 1d3+3 Shock or 1d3+1 Wounds. Once used, the soul stone takes time to recover, and cannot be used until after your next Regroup.

name: Pain Casket (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These psychoreactive devices, made of tortured wraithbone, draw in the pain and dread felt by those nearby, and can be drawn out by any who need it.
effect: Add one Pain point to the Casket whenever an enemy does certain actions within 12 metres. Drukhari within 6 metres of the Casket may, as a Simple Action, draw a Pain point from the Casket to either recover 1d3 Shock or to count towards the Power Through Pain talent.

name: Living Trophy (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Wrought from the still-living flesh, a living trophy writhes with agony at every moment. This pain is a far cry from the torments that can be wrought upon the truly-living, but it can bolster the bearer as they hunt.
effect: In combat, you recover 1 Shock at the start of each of your turns.

name: Soul-Scent Barb (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These bizarre thorny devices can dig into the soul of your prey through the warp, allowing the bearer to track them with uncanny precision.
effect: After a Regroup, you may attune the barb to a single foe whose identity you know or who you have some physical artefact of. You gain +3 bonus dice on all Awareness and Survival tests to detect or track them.

name: Soul-Trap (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Though soul-traps vary in size and appearance, from folding pyramidal prisms to jewelled skulls engraved with vampiric runes, they all have one functionâ€”to capture the soul of a powerful foe within its confines and empower the bearer with the stolen energies.
effect: Whenever you slay an Adversary Threat or Monstrous Creature, you may attempt a Willpower test with a DN equal to the enemy's Willpower. If you succeed, the enemy's essence is drawn into the soul-trap, and the stolen power doubles your Strength attribute until your next Regroup.

name: Vexator Mask (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: This mask often takes the form of a delicate skein of bone and skin adorned with runes of confusion and illusion. It projects the image of the viewer's most trusted friend, beloved ruler, or loved one, often buying the wearer scant moments of time in battle.
effect: You may make a Deception Interaction Attack against an enemy you are engaged with as a Simple Action.

name: Armoured Cockpit
description: Extra protection for the Pilot to ensure they deliver destruction and passengers safely.
effect: Grants crew inside the vehicle's cockpit an AR of 4 against any attack originating from outside the vehicle.

name: Bomb Rack
description: Designed for the Archaeopter Fusilave, this system drops masses of tectomagnic munitions.
effect: After completing Movement, as a standard Action, a flying vehicle may drop up to 3 bombs at any points beneath its flight path. Treat as Frag Missiles at short range. Loaded with 12 Bombs, not reloadable during flight.

name: Broad Spectrum Data-Tether
description: An arcane device that projects a Tech-Priest's commands to Skitarii units at distance.
effect: Functions as a Vox Caster. Any ADEPTUS MECHANICUS character with access gains +1 bonus die to Conviction, Resolve, and Determination Tests.

name: Chaff Launcher
description: Similar to a Smoke Launcher, disperses material to protect the vehicle from targeting.
effect: Pilot can use Reflexive Action when targeted to increase vehicle's Defence by 4. Must be Reloaded out of combat (Value 3, Common).

name: Dozer Blade
description: A large, reinforced plate mounted to the front of a vehicle to demolish objects in its path.
effect: When Ramming, adds +2 ED to damage. Add +2 bonus dice to Pilot (A) Tests to push through obstructing terrain. Large or larger vehicle only.

name: Dozer Ram
description: An upgraded variant of the Dozer Blade designed for suppressing crowds.
effect: When Ramming, adds +4 ED to damage and reduces self-damage by 2 ED. Add +4 bonus dice to Pilot (A) Tests to push through terrain. Large or larger vehicle only.

name: Drilldozer Blade
description: An industrialised variant of the Dozer Blade, a Drilldozer Blade has multiple revolving spiked plows that chew through rock as though it were vellum parchment, and it wreaks much worse havoc on flesh.
effect: When Ramming, adds +6 ED to damage. Add +6 bonus dice to Pilot (A) Tests to push through terrain. Halves vehicle Manoeuvrability. Large or larger vehicle only.

name: Emanatus Force Field
description: Used on Mechanicum vehicles, this protective device uses layers of energy that operate akin to personal Refractor Fields. Enemy strikes are seamlessly absorbed, their energy transformed into harmless flashes of light.
effect: The AP of any attack made on the vehicle is reduced to 0.

name: Flare Launcher
description: An inexpensive signalling device that also hampers enemy targeting with obscuring smoke.
effect: Loaded with 6 Flares. Fire as Simple Action: +2 Defence against shooting until end of following Round. Allies on bikes within 12m treat Speed as 6 higher.

name: Gunnery Servitor
description: A lobotomised Servitor augmented to accurately fire a single weapon.
effect: Built into a weapon, permanently occupying a crew slot. Fires the weapon using a Ballistic Skill (A) pool of 5 dice.

name: Smoke Launcher
description: A common attachment, this item fires a dense cloud that obscures a vehicle from enemy view. While it offers little protection against massed firepower, it does hinder enemy tank aces in achieving careful aim.
effect: Loaded with 6 Smoke Grenades. Fire as Simple Action: Medium Blast (9m radius) smoke. Targets in smoke gain +3 Defence vs shooting, +2 vs melee. Visibility reduced to 2m.

name: Auspex Array
description: A collection of smaller Auspexes empowered by linked communications and multiplicative prayers to the Machine God, an Auspex Array allows Marines to scan battlefields for any sign of their myriad foes.
effect: Can be activated as a Combat Action to detect energy, motion, and other life signs within 1 kilometre.

name: Auto Launcher
description: Six barrels capable of launching a salvo of grenades with simple operation.
effect: An Auto Launcher can fire 3 grenades at any point within 100 metres as a Simple Action. An Auto Launcher is loaded with a magazine of 6 grenades of one type, either Frag, Krak, or Smoke. A Smoke Grenade fills an area equivalent to that of a Medium Blast (9-metre Radius) with thick white smoke. Visibility within the smoke is reduced to 2 metres. Targets obscured by smoke gain +3 Defence against shooting attacks and +2 against melee attacks.

name: Awakened Machine Spirit
description: Land Raiders and other venerable Astartes vehicles contain these manifestations of the Omnissiah. Some are thousands of years old and can both aid the occupants and, if necessary, operate the vehicle should the occupants have been injured or killed.
effect: Vehicle requires 1 fewer Crew. If all occupants killed/unable to act, operates on its own for 1d6 Turns (Skill 6 for any vehicle operation).

name: Combi-Flamer (Vehicle)
description: A vehicle-mounted Combi-Weapon combining a Boltgun and Flamer.
effect: May fire as either or both component weapons each round. Firing both is a Multi-Attack.

name: Combi-Grenade Launcher (Vehicle)
description: A vehicle-mounted Combi-Weapon combining a Boltgun and Grenade Launcher.
effect: May fire as either or both component weapons each round. Firing both is a Multi-Attack.

name: Combi-Melta (Vehicle)
description: A vehicle-mounted Combi-Weapon combining a Boltgun and Meltagun.
effect: May fire as either or both component weapons each round. Firing both is a Multi-Attack.

name: Combi-Plasma (Vehicle)
description: A vehicle-mounted Combi-Weapon combining a Boltgun and Plasma Gun.
effect: May fire as either or both component weapons each round. Firing both is a Multi-Attack.

name: Combi-Grav (Vehicle)
description: A vehicle-mounted Combi-Weapon combining a Boltgun and Grav-gun.
effect: May fire as either or both component weapons each round. Firing both is a Multi-Attack.

name: Infernum Halo Launcher
description: Capable of firing a fusillade of Flares as a defensive countermeasure to distract automatically aimed anti-air projectiles, the Infernum Halo Launcher creates a ring of holy light that defends Imperial craft, reminiscent of the protective gaze of the Emperor.
effect: Activate as Reflexive Action when targeted. Vehicle's Defence increased by +4 until start of next Round.

name: Orbital Comms Array
description: Advanced communications technology to call down firepower from Imperial Cruisers in the void.
effect: Vehicle is treated as having the Bombardment Talent, usable once per session by anyone aboard.

name: Repulsor Field
description: A relic of ancient technologies providing a gravitic field for hovering above ground.
effect: The vehicle may ignore any terrain penalties to Movement, including impenetrable terrain such as lakes or rivers of boiling lava. At the start of the Pilot's Turn, the field can make all terrain within 12 metres act as Difficult, even for characters who can ignore such effects; this lasts until the start of the Pilot's next Turn.

name: Shield Dome
description: A large Refractor Field designed to cloak an entire vehicle with protective energies.
effect: Huge or larger vehicle only. Vehicle gains +3* Resilience.

name: Siege Shield
description: Thick ceramite plating for safety during sieges and plowing through enemy defences.
effect: Functions as Dozer Blade (+2 ED ramming, +2 dice terrain). Also increases Resilience by +3. Large or larger vehicle only.

name: Holo-Field
description: A Holo-Field does not negate firepower with sheer energy. Instead, it reflects the Aeldari approach of subtlety and misdirection, using distorting patterns to confound enemies so that aiming is almost impossible.
effect: Attacks against the vehicle suffer +3 DN. Large or larger vehicle only.

name: Mindshock Pod
description: A psychic weapon that assaults the minds of nearby enemies.
