effect: The Pilot of a vehicle equipped with a Mindshock Pod can use the Pod as a Simple Action if the Pilot has the PSYKER and ASURYANI Keywords. All enemies within 24 metres must make a DN 3 Resolve Test. If they fail, they suffer a Mortal Wound.

name: Power Field (Vehicle)
description: This device protects a vehicle with a nearly impervious field of energy, an uncommon approach for the Aeldari but still effective enough to turn aside Lascannons and other powerful weaponry.
effect: Vehicle gains +6 Resilience.

name: Vehicular Spirit Stone
description: When mounted within a Hemlock Wraithfighter, these arcane stones aid in piloting the vehicle by allowing the essences of the Aeldari within each to act as co-pilots, offering whispered advice and even operating the vehicle's basic controls should the Pilot be stricken.
effect: +1 bonus die to all Actions involving the vehicle. No Actions suffer penalty greater than +3 DN. If occupants killed, operates vehicle for 1d6 Turns (Skill 6).

name: Daemonic Machine Spirit
description: Foul echoes of the Omnissian Machine Spirit, these abominations are corrupted remnants of the proud entities of millennia ago. Some are actual daemonic spirits who possess a vehicle and urge it towards greater bloodshed and destruction.
effect: +1 bonus die to operate the vehicle in combat. On Complication, +1 DN penalty until occupant redeems self.

name: Bladevanes (Wargear)
description: Razor-sharp blades mounted on Drukhari vehicles that slash enemies during movement.
effect: Automatically deal Dmg 8, ED 4, AP 1 to enemies within 2m during movement.

name: Chain Snare
description: Each of these vicious assortments of hooks, barbed chains, and other implements of cruelty allow a vehicle to inflict bladed pain upon anyone they pass over.
effect: +2 dice ramming infantry. Hit target must DN 3 Athletics or Restrained (DN 5 Athletics to free). Dragged target takes Dmg 7 per Turn.

name: Cluster Caltrops
description: Using a variety of techniques, from proximity-sensor detonations to primitive metal spikes, these items are usually scattered along likely lines of enemy retreat to inflict additional damage on terrified prey.
effect: Deploy as Free Action: 10m diameter or 4m x 20m line. Entering targets must DN 3 Athletics or take 1 Wound per metre moved.

name: Grav-Talon (Wargear)
description: This wicked device uses gravity pressure waves to smash into any unfortunate enough to be in the path of the vehicle, leaving them exposed for the kill.
effect: Automatically deal Dmg 10, ED 5, AP 1 to enemies within 3m during movement.

name: Grisly Trophies
description: Grisly Trophies adorn most of the raiding vehicles of their species. These trophies are more than a badge of honour, as the Drukhari use them to strike a delectable fear into the hearts of their enemies in an attempt to scatter their ranks.
effect: Choose a Keyword. Targets sharing that Keyword within 100m must pass DN 4 Willpower or gain Fear. +2 DN to Resolve Tests.

name: Night Shield
description: Weaving an unnatural tapestry of sinister shifting shadows, the Night Shield replicates the horrific darkness of Commorragh, making the equipped vehicle very difficult to target.
effect: Vehicle always counts as in total darkness: +4 DN to BS/Awareness attacks, +3 DN to melee attacks against it.

name: Shock Prow
description: An electrified ramming prow that stuns victims on impact.
effect: When Ramming, a vehicle with a Shock Prow adds +4 ED to the damage roll against the target, and that damage is treated as Agonising if the target is a living creature. Additionally, you can add +2 bonus dice to any Pilot (A) Tests to push through obstructing terrain.

name: Splinter Racks
description: Viciously well engineered to improve the fire rate of fearsome Drukhari weaponry, Splinter Racks speed the process of emptying a magazine into the enemy and ensure a fresh, fully loaded weapon is always available.
effect: Rapid Fire weapons gain ED equal to their Rapid Fire rating at Short and Medium range.

name: Living Metal
description: Necron vehicles are made from the same living metal that comprises all Necron technology, making such constructs extremely difficult to destroy, as sophisticated nanomachines constantly knit damaged hulls back together.
effect: Unless it is destroyed, a vehicle with the NECRON Keyword removes 1 Wound from itself at the beginning of each Round.

name: Nebuloscope
description: An advanced Necron targeting device. Tomb Blade only.
effect: Ignore target Defence bonuses from cover and environment.

name: Quantum Shielding
description: Advanced Necron protective shielding that phases in and out of existence.
effect: A Necron vehicle with Quantum Shielding gains +3 bonus Defence. If a vehicle with Quantum Shielding takes damage, it loses the +3 bonus Defence for the duration of the combat. The bonus Defence is regained when the equipped vehicle has been out of combat for 1 hour.

name: Shadowloom
description: A Necron stealth device that cloaks the vehicle. Tomb Blade only.
effect: +3 Defence.

name: Shield Vanes
description: Protective vanes that increase vehicle resilience. Tomb Blade only.
effect: +4 Resilience.

name: 'Ard Case
description: Extra armour plating bolted on by Ork Meks to protect the vehicle.
effect: +2 Resilience. Replaces Open Topped trait with Sealed.

name: Blastajet Force Field
description: A force field projector mounted on Ork aircraft. ORK AIRCRAFT only.
effect: All ORK AIRCRAFT within 10m gain +3* Resilience.

name: Deff Rolla
description: A massive roller mounted on the front of Ork vehicles for crushing enemies.
effect: When Ramming, adds +4 ED. Add +4 bonus dice to Pilot (A) Tests to push through terrain.

name: Fuel-Mixa Grot
description: A Grot dedicated to mixing volatile fuel to boost vehicle speed.
effect: Vehicle gains Turbo Boost (2) or adds +2 to existing Turbo Boost (X). Does not occupy a Crew/Passenger slot.

name: Grot Gunner
description: A Grot assigned to one weapon for additional firing accuracy.
effect: Assigned to one weapon. Reroll any result of 1 when firing that weapon. Does not occupy a Crew/Passenger slot.

name: Grot Riggers
description: A team of Grots that scurry about repairing damage during combat.
effect: Occupy 1 Crew/Passenger slot. Can attempt Emergency Repair once per Turn with dice pool 4. On failure, can be 'encouraged' (auto-success but reduces pool by 1). Pool resets at Ork settlement.

name: Nose Drill
description: A massive drill mounted on the nose of Ork vehicles for devastating rams.
effect: When Ramming, adds +6 ED with AP -2. Add +6 bonus dice to Pilot (A) Tests to push through terrain.

name: Squig Mine
description: An explosive squig set as a mine that detonates when triggered.
effect: Set as Combat Action. When triggered, explodes: Dmg 8, ED 8, AP -2, Blast 10, Inflict (Poisoned).

name: The Endless Grimoire
description: Within the pages of this magical tome lie the secrets of every cantrip, incantation and spell ever conceived. Though the bearer of this grimoire has access to the infinite knowledge bound within, they must battle the temptation simply to fall into the flickering pages of the tome and drink in endless reams of knowledge until they lose all grasp or influence upon the events transpiring around them.
effect: The wielder must be a Psyker. With an action, they can use it to make a Scholar (Int) Test, to look for information about a psychic power they do not possess. On success, they may immediately use that power as a Free Action, acting as though they possessed the power and associated psychic discipline. They must reattempt this Scholar Test each time they want to use a psychic power they do not possess.

name: The Impossible Robe
description: The wearer of this robe exists between several realities at once. Thus can a daemonic commander potentially control Tzeentch's interests in multiple times and places simultaneously to further multiple aspects of the Great Plan. This effect makes it hard for foes to truly harm the wearer, who flickers between planes of reality in an unpredictable fashion. However, the robe is capricious, and has been known to rip its wearer out of reality altogether should they lose control of its powers.
effect: This relic may only be worn by someone with the Mark of Tzeentch. It is armour with AR 5 and the Power Field trait. If the wielder rolls a Complication in a combat where the wielder has been attacked, at the GM's discretion the Impossible Robe may be the subject of the Complication. This can result in the wearer being transported into the immaterium or a rent in the immaterium opening.

name: The Everstave
description: This staff blazes with vibrant warpflame. As soon as its master takes up the eldritch weapon, they too are wreathed in the same daemonic fire. From within this magenta inferno, the Everstave's daemonic bearer hurls searing gouts of Tzeentch's pink fire, turning armour to ash and immolating or irrevocably mutating the flesh beneath.
effect: The wielder must be a Psyker with the Mark of Tzeentch. It can be used as a weapon with the following profile: (S)+4 +2 ED / AP -1 / Brutal, Force. In addition, when using a psychic power, the wielder may shift 2 Icons to make any Deny the Witch attempts automatically fail.

name: Warpfire Blade
description: Existing in nine times nine dimensions, the Warpfire Blade flickers with its bearer's sorcerous power. Every iteration of the blade strikes in differing forms and at varying angles â€“ a plane of sharpened will, an outstretched hand of friendship, a wave of stellar fire â€“ seeking a route through every sub-existence to sever the soul of those it strikes.
effect: The wielder must be a Psyker with the Mark of Tzeentch. It can be used as a weapon with the following profile: (S)+7 +4 ED / AP -3 / Force, Parry. In addition, any roll of a 6 on an ED inflicts a Mortal Wound in addition to increasing damage as an Exalted Icon.

name: Soulbane
description: This incorporeal blade inflicts no harm upon its victim's physical body, instead carving its way through the stuff of their very soul. So ephemeral and unreal is this strange weapon that it is impossible to cross blades with Soulbane, for its ghostly edge will pass straight through any guard. Those struck by Soulbane collapse in agony, writhing and screaming as their lacerated essences slowly bleed away into the immaterium.
effect: The wielder must be a Psyker with the Mark of Tzeentch. It can be used as a weapon with the following profile: (S)+4 +2 ED / AP -1 / Brutal, Force. In addition, when the wielder inflicts one or more Wounds with a psychic power, they may spend 1 Glory (or Ruin as appropriate) to immediately recover Wounds equal to the number inflicted.

name: Soul-Eater Stave
description: Invisible to those without witch-sight, ethereal pseudopods, grasping talons and maws of non-matter surround this twisted staff, ever alert to the cry of a soul newly torn from its body. Riding the power channelled by the staff's bearer, they hungrily devour every scrap of life essence they can catch before it is lost to the maelstrom of the warp's myriad predators. This unholy feast serves to infuse the stave's daemon wielder with stolen vigour, which flows from the weapon into its master through its nightmarish web of tendrils and parasitic tethers.
effect: The wielder must be a Psyker with the Mark of Tzeentch. It can be used as a weapon with the following profiles: (S)+5 +4 ED / AP -3 / Force, Brutal OR 12 +2 ED / AP -1 / 6 - 12 - 18 / Brutal, Spread, Pistol.

name: Horn of Nurgle's Rot
description: A daemon crowned with this repulsive horn can, with but a single touch, infect mortal victims with Nurgle's Rot. Even as the afflicted lay dying, their bodies and souls decay and deform, despair curdling their last moments. What were once enemy soldiers rise anew as Plaguebearers of Nurgle, and shamble to take their place in the festering ranks of their fellows.
effect: The wielder must have the Mark of Nurgle keyword. This relic may be used as a weapon with the following profile: (S)+2 +2 ED / Inflict (Poisoned 5). In addition, each turn when the victim checks to remove the Poisoned condition, they suffer another (S)+2 +2 ED damage. If the victim dies while under the effects of the Poisoned condition from the relic, they transform into a Plaguebearer of Nurgle. The transformation is permanent and may not be reversed.

name: Tome of a Thousand Poxes
description: How this rotten volume found its way out of the diseased libraries of the scholar Ku'gath may never be known, but within its foetid daemon-hide pages are the secrets of many of that daemon's most ruinous plagues. Even the simplest infection can bloom into new and vibrant potency by using the arcane incantations it contains, each inscribed in divine ichor.
effect: The wielder must be a Psyker with the Mark of Nurgle keyword. Any time the wielder uses a psychic power that deals damage, that power gains the Inflict (Poisoned 3) characteristic. If the power already inflicts the Poisoned condition, the effect value of the condition is increased by +1.

name: The Entropic Knell
description: To hear the grim tolling of this great bell upon the winds is a death sentence, for its sound heralds the arrival of the Plague Legions. Such is its dread power that a single peal reverberates for long minutes, spreading despair even over the clangour of battle.
effect: The wielder must have the Mark of Nurgle keyword. As an action, the wielder may choose to ring the bell. All who hear it must make a DN 5 Fear Test.

name: Corruption
description: This fabled weapon is the physical manifestation of corruption. Constantly dripping with foul ooze, the merest scratch from its edge is enough to lay low the hardiest foe, and its toxins can effortlessly overcome even the resilience of a Space Marine.
effect: The wielder of this relic must have the Mark of Nurgle. This relic may be used as a weapon with the following profile: (S) +6 +5 ED / AP -2 / Brutal, Parry, Inflict (Poisoned 4), Inflict (Bleeding).

name: The Endless Gift
description: Only the most accomplished of Nurgle's followers are granted the Endless Gift. A disease of unutterable malignancy and repulsive beneficence, it changes form constantly from plague to infestation to malaise. The one constant is its ability to reknit its sufferer's corporeal form from even the most catastrophic of wounds. One moment, infernal bacteria may multiply like wildfire until their gelid mass fills a fleshy rent with fresh daemon-flesh. The next, pestilential vapours may billow from the hosts's yawning maw, veiling its ravaged bulk before tattering away to reveal a form healed of its recent hurts. However it happens, the longer the enemy must watch their efforts to fell the host falter, the more their despair feeds into the gift and increases its supernatural potency.
effect: The wielder must have the Mark of Nurgle keyword. At the start of their turn, the wielder heals 1 Wound. If they are at maximum Wounds, they heal up to their Corruption Level in Shock per round. Any time they heal in this way, a portion of their body undergoes a physical change, reflective of the transformative disease progression. Viewers must make a DN 4 Fear Test.

name: Effluvior
description: Within the hanging skulls of this accursed flail, there is a rancid rot-hole burrowing through reality itself. Down these vile channels rush torrents of liquid warp-filth, the raw and seething slops of the Garden of Nurgle. With every ponderous swing and bludgeoning impact, Effluvior's skulls spray fans of this lethal slime, causing victims to contort as flesh, metal and bone putrefy. Those not pulverised by the brutal swings are instead reduced to a slick of slime that seeps back into Nurgle's metaphysical realm.
effect: The wielder must have the Mark of Nurgle keyword. This relic may be used as a weapon with the following profile: (S) +2 +3 ED / AP -2 / Range 3 - 6 - 9 / Inflict (Poisoned 3), Spread, Warp Weapon.

name: Rune of Brass
description: Khorne despises sorcerers above all, and his favoured disciples may earn the Rune of Brass in order to shield them from the cowardly powers of witches. Etched into a daemon's armour â€“ or embedded into its flesh â€“ the Rune of Brass retains the infernal heat of its creation. The glare of its still-molten form is agony to witches, for it conjures the all-consuming blaze of the pyre, and twists their powers against them.
effect: Any Psyker attempting to use a psychic power within 15 metres of the Rune must add an additional +2 DN to their Psychic Mastery (Wil) Test. In addition, if a Psyker must roll on the Perils of the Warp Table while within 15 metres of the Rune, they roll twice and must pick the worse result.

name: Armour of Scorn
description: Forged aeons ago in the Brass Citadel of Khorne itself, this hellish armour is saturated with the Blood God's contempt for weakness, unworthy foes, and sorcerers. In battle, it shrugs off all but the mightiest blows, and shields the wearer with this same burning scorn against all enemies before them.
effect: Only Greater Daemons and Daemon Princes of Khorne may don the Armour of Scorn. It has an AR of 7, and counts as Invulnerable (Wrath & Glory, p. 232) against any weapon that deals less than 14 base Damage (i.e. the weapon's Damage stat without ED, Shifted Icons etc.). In addition, whenever a psychic power would cause the wearer to suffer Wounds, roll 1d6; On a 5+, the number of Wounds taken is halved, rounding up.

name: Blood-Drinker Talisman
description: Upon manifesting in realspace, a daemon of Khorne may find this relic bound within their body as a sign of their god's favour. Found on the blasted surface of an Aeldari crone world, this gemstone shines with a malevolent, murderous sentience. It radiates palpable murderlust, drinking in the blood that spatters across its wearer's flesh, and returning a portion of that stolen life force to them by reknitting their corporeal form, that they may continue to spill blood in Khorne's name.
effect: Every time a Threat with the Blood-Drinker Talisman kills one or more enemies (or indeed allies), roll 1d6; on a 5+, they regain d6 lost Wounds. The bearer cannot recover more than their Toughness in Wounds in a single Round.

name: The Crimson Crown
description: It is said that this crown was created from a single drop of Khorne's blood. A measure of the Blood God's endless wrath is bound within the crown, and its effect upon his daemonic servants is palpable. Fuelled by the artefact's fell presence, Khorne's daemons are driven to ever greater heights of savagery and slaughter.
effect: A Threat wearing the Crimson Crown generates 1 extra Ruin each Turn. If the Threat cannot use Ruin Actions, it gains the Champion bonus, gaining 1 personal Ruin, allowing it to use Ruin Actions and generating 1 Ruin per Turn.

name: A'rgath, the King of Blades
description: Most daemons despise being bound to material objects. This cannot be said of A'rgath. Once a mortal champion of Khorne, a lifetime of butchery earned him the Blood God's favour, and A'rgath was granted daemonhood. However, so dedicated was A'rgath to slaughter and death that he refused to accept immortality as a Daemon Prince, instead choosing to take the form of a mighty blade, that he might forever spill the blood of Khorne's enemies. In battle the spirit of A'rgath guides the wielder's hand, granting them unrivalled fury and skill.
effect: A'rgath can take the form of any bladed melee weapon, to suit the proficiencies of any disciple or daemon of Khorne. It gains the statistics of that weapon, and a +4 bonus to its base Damage and ED. It ignores the Invulnerable armour Trait (Wrath & Glory, p. 232), causes Mortal Wounds, and always inflicts 1 Mortal Wound that cannot be averted by any means on a successful strike.

name: Skullreaver
description: Khorne abhors weakness in His servants, but does not waste the skills of worthy foes. Thus when a Bloodthirster was defeated in a mighty duel with another of the Blood God's champions, the greater daemon found itself bound into the form of a mighty axe. The terrible rage of the trapped daemon causes the runes inscribed on the blade to blaze with the fury of a captured sun, and its edge to remain sharp beyond the physical laws of realspace. Perhaps one day the daemon within will summon enough fury to break free, and it will finally learn its master's lesson; had it summoned such anger in its fateful duel, it would have triumphed.
effect: Only a Bloodthirster may wield Skullreaver. It replaces its Axe of Khorne with the following values: 20 +6 ED / AP -5 / Range 2 / Brutal.

name: The Forbidden Gem
description: Aeldari legend claims this gem was the largest, purest diamond in all their empire before the Fall. Its keeper, a noble named Ydrisyll, was obsessively proud of his beautiful possession, and guarded it with infinite jealousy. When the birth of Slaanesh tore the empire apart, one of the first acts of She-Who-Thirsts was to imprison Ydrisyll's soul inside the gem he so coveted in life. Now the corrupted diamond inspires uncontrollable jealousy in all who see it, consuming their focus and will as they are consumed by greed.
effect: Once per turn, the holder of the Forbidden Gem may target any Agent; That Agent becomes Hindered and may not use their Archetype Ability on their next turn.

name: The Mark of Excess
description: Pleasure and addiction go hand in hand in the court of Slaanesh, and his mark is equal parts blessing and curse. Whenever the recipient kills a worthy foe, they are rewarded with an explosion of sensory bliss so utterly beyond compare that they will do anything to feel such ecstasy again. They become peerless warriors, but it is a hollow perfection, driven by addiction to a high that never lasts.
effect: Daemons carrying the Mark of Excess get +1 bonus die to all Weapon Skill (I) Tests. Each combat, whenever an attack of theirs downs an enemy, disables a vehicle, or causes a Critical Hit, they gain another cumulative +1 bonus die to Attack rolls.

name: Soulstealer
description: A Keeper of Secrets lies bound within this master-crafted blade. Infernal lore relates that this greater daemon once sought to consume enough Aeldari souls to rival Slaanesh Herself. As punishment for its hubris, Slaanesh bound it to Soulstealer. Now, the gluttonous blade invigorates its wielder with the souls it devours, condemning the daemon to an eternity of starvation as it helps others glut themselves on souls it can never possess.
effect: ...Soulstealer gains the Brutal Trait when attacking anyone with the AELDARI Keyword. Soulstealer: (S) +6 +6 ED / AP -3 / Range 2 / Agonising, Parry

name: Silverstrike
description: This daemonic blade strikes so swiftly it appears to simply bypass the space between its wielder and its target. Conversely, those struck by the weapon find their movements slowed to a crawl, their limbs refusing to obey as bliss floods the body from each wound.
effect: ...This effect may be applied to an opponent a number of times equal to the wielder's Conviction. Silverstrike: (S) +8 +6 ED / AP -3 / Range 2 / Agonising, Parry

name: Slothful Claws
description: These weapons have worn many faces and adorned many daemons through the ages. Forged from the essence of a Keeper of Secrets, the slightest scratch infects victims with a blissful lethargy, smothering their thoughts and weighing heavy on their limbs.
effect: A Daemonette with Ravaging Claws or Snapping Claws may upgrade to Slothful Claws. Their attacks gain +2 ED, and anyone who takes Wounds from Slothful Claws may not use or benefit from any Archetype Abilities until the Daemonette's next Turn.

name: Whip of Agony
description: This living weapon coils like a serpent around its owner's limbs, hiding in plain sight until willed to strike. The Whip of Agony secretes a psychic poison that links its sentience with the nervous system of whoever it touches. Over this connection, the whip can force the target's body to feel anything it wishes, and it possesses a boundlessly cruel and spiteful imagination. Victims are typically overwhelmed with pain and perverse horrors only a daemon of Slaanesh could conceive.
effect: A Herald or Keeper of Secrets may upgrade their Lashes of Torment/Living Whip to a Whip of Agony. Any attacks with a Whip of Agony that score a Wrath Critical allow the wielder to make another attack as a Free Action. In addition, an attack that hits but does not Wound still inflicts 1 Shock.

name: Brazier of Holy Fire
description: The blazing zeal of the Ecclesiarchy rendered real in sacred flame, ensconced in iron wrought with the aches of priests, a Brazier of Holy Fire can only be lit by a true devotee of the Emperor, and its light bears a modicum of His magnificent power.
effect: Anyone can attempt to light a Brazier of Holy Fire as a Combat Action. When lit, the Brazier sheds bright light for 6 metres. If a character with at least one Faith point wields the Brazier of Holy Fire, any character with the DAEMON Keyword touched by its light is Hindered. A character wielding a Brazier of Holy Fire can spend 1 Faith point to unleash the holy flames as a Reflexive Action. This attack functions in the same way as a Hand Flamer (Wrath & Glory Rulebook, p.219) but has +3 ED. If the target of this attack has the DAEMON Keyword, the attack has +6 ED instead.

name: Grapnel Launcher
description: A simple tool utilised by deep-striking Primaris forces, a grapnel launcher can quietly pull the full weight of a Primaris Astartes to an advantageous vertical position in seconds.
effect: The grapnel launcher has a medium range of 30 metres, and can be fired as a Combat Action like a normal Ranged Weapon into any surface with a default DN of 3. If successfully fired into a surface, the grapnel latches on, and can be retracted to pull you up to that surface as a Free Action.

name: Infravisor
description: An advanced technological visor often installed into the augers and augmetic eyes of the Adeptus Mechanicus, the Infravisor allows its user to see into a wide range of spectra simultaneously, including several the Mechanicus do not truly understand.
effect: An Infravisor functions as Preysense Goggles (Wrath & Glory Rulebook, p.239), and also allows you to detect high levels of radiation in your immediate environment.

name: Abeyant
description: Taking the form of an ornate throne, pulpit, or lectern, an Abeyant is directly integrated into its owner's augmetics and uses anti-gravitic levitation technology to convey them over battlefields to survey the troops they command. Merging machine and body in such an extensive way is a sign of status as much as a representative of dedication to the Machine Cult.
effect: Allows you to hover up to 3 metres off the ground and move at your Speed. If you are falling, the Abeyant slows your fall so that you land safely. Requirements: Four other Augmetics.

name: B.O.N.E
description: Though Ogryns are undeniably unintelligent as a Species, some are smarter than others. These few bright sparks that can count above three, display consistent object permanence, or can even handle basic problem solving, are marked out as suitable for the Biochemical Ogryn Neural Enhancement procedure, further improving their intelligence. These Ogryns are known as Bone'eads, utilising the boosted intelligence afforded by their cerebral implants to lead others in battle.
effect: Raises your Maximum Intellect to 3 and increases your Intellect by 1. Requirements: Ogryn Species, Leadership 1, Rank 3.

name: Chordclaw
description: The scalpel fingers of a Chordclaw are known to disassemble a body with the soulless efficiency typical to the Adeptus Mechanicus. The three needle-sharp digits of a Chordclaw move with unnerving speed, quickened further by the stomach-turning sonic resonance of all transonic weapons.
effect: Your hand is replaced by a Chordclaw. Your Chordclaw hand functions as a normal hand, but also replaces your Unarmed Strike with the weapon profile below.

name: Enhanced Ballistic Mechadendrite
description: ...and blast their enemies with arane technology.
effect: When you fire your Enhanced Ballistic Mechadendrite as part of a Multi-Action or Multi-Attack, the DN penalty is decreased by 2. The weapon never needs to be reloaded, but when you use a Salvo Option with your Enhanced Ballistic Mechadendrite you suffer Shock equal to the weapon's Salvo rating. Requirements: The weapon you want to integrate into the Enhanced Ballistic Mechadendrite.

name: 9-70 Entrenching Tool
description: More than a simple trowel, the composite edge of this tool can break up even the hardest packed earth.
effect: Halves the time needed to dig trenches, foxholes, and other earthen fortifications. It also makes for a sturdy improvised weapon.

name: Diagnostor
description: This sensitive medical cogitator monitors a patient's health and biorhythms and aids in the diagnosis of virtually any physical ailment.
effect: +1 bonus die to Medicae (Int) Tests to detect and diagnose diseases, injuries, and ailments, and to determine cause of death.

name: Mag-Boots
description: Built into the feet of most Void Suits and the armour of elite Imperial troops, these bulky boots can be highly magnetized at the wearer's whim to secure them to a metallic surface.
effect: When activated with a Simple Action, the wearer's feet are fully secured to any metallic surface. The wearer's feet cannot be removed from the metallic surface by any means, other than their own volition. The wearer can walk and move on the metallic surface whilst the boots are on, but their Speed is reduced by 3.

name: Martyr's Gift Medikit
description: This upgraded kit is a superior version of the standard Astra Militarum Medikit. Loaded with combat stimms, auto-cauterising thermic gel, and single-use disposable bionics, this medikit ensures that wounded Tempestus Scions rapidly and efficiently get back into the fight. The Martyr's Gift even features a belt of subcutaneous frag charges that can be used to booby-trap a terminally wounded Scion's body.
effect: Functions as a Medikit. Includes a standard augmetic replacement for any lost limb or eye; the augmetic is temporary, and becomes useless after 24 hours. The subcutaneous frag charge has the same damage profile as a Frag Missile.

name: Monoscope
description: Though it can be used to project a beam of light, a monoscope's primary purpose is to record and upload visual data. If authorised and in possession of the correct command runes, an individual can connect their data-slate to the monoscope and see through the device's lens.
effect: Can act as a light source and show live footage if connected wirelessly to a data-slate.

name: Periculum Kit
description: Assembled for agents of the Varonius Flotilla, these sturdy grox-hide satchels contain what supplies they can spare for those capable few able and willing to assist in the defence of the Gilead System.
effect: Contains: Chrono, Data-Slate, Magnocular Scope, Respirator, Vox-bead, and 2 Ration Packs.

name: Slate Monitron
description: This Data-Slate is typically incorporated into an armoured forearm bracer or gauntlet. It monitors the wearer's vital signs, showing the pulse rate and health matrix of the wearer.
effect: +2 bonus dice to Medicae (Int) Tests made to heal your Wounds.

name: Webway Keystone
description: This triangular wraithbone amulet is all too easily mistaken for jewellery by lesser Species. The psychic micro circuitry woven into its core allows the wearer to interface with Webway portals.
effect: You can make a DN 5 Tech (Int) Test to activate either of the following effects: Detect the distance and orientation of the nearest Webway portal. Open or close a Webway portal within 30 metres. Large or complex gates have higher DNs.

name: Dok's Toolz
description: Little more than a bloodstained satchel stuffed with sharp implements and homebrewed painkillers, a Dok Bag contains everything a Painboy needs to keep his Boyz in the fight and dabble in some elective surgery on the side.
effect: Functions as a Medikit for Ork biology. Whenever you roll a Complication whilst using Dok's Toolz, the target suffers either 1 Wound or 1 Shock, whichever is funnier.

name: Mek Toolz
description: Steered by the mad inspiration of Ork Mekboyz, these collections of oversized hammers and spanners can bend or break existing technology to make it 'Orky'.
effect: Functions as a Combi-Tool (p.236) for Ork technology. Mek Toolz can be used to dismantle technology and reassemble it into Ork Wargear of an equal or lesser Value and Rarity. This re-assembly requires a Tech (Int) Test with a DN equal to the Value of the Ork Wargear you are creating, and takes a number of hours equal to the Value of the Wargear you are creating.

name: Ammo Backpack
description: A large backpack designed to carry significant quantities of ammunition, favoured by those who expect prolonged engagements.
effect: You can carry 10 additional Ammo. Comes stocked with 3 available Ammo.

name: Bandolier
description: A simple belt or strap worn across the body, fitted with loops or pouches for carrying extra ammunition.
effect: You can carry 2 additional Ammo. Comes stocked with 3 available Ammo.

name: Ammo Runt
description: An Orkoid lackey that crafts and manages the ammunition of its designated master with a snivelling fastidiousness.
effect: The Ammo Runt has the profile of a Grot and follows all the owner's commands more or less loyally. You ignore all Complications related to your ranged weapons and gain +2 Ammo, which the Ammo Runt carries.

name: Auger Array
description: A collection of sub-dermal micro-cogitators and protruding sensory clusters wired directly into the recipient's visual cortex grant a sixth sense.
effect: You have either an Auspex or a Diagnostor permanently implanted in your brain. You can take this implant twice, choosing the Auspex or Diagnostor each time.

name: Augmetic Respirator
description: Oxygen pumps, molecular gas filters, and rebreathing ducts replace the fleshy bellows of your lungs.
effect: You gain +1 bonus die to Toughness Tests to resist toxic gasses and airborne poisons or diseases. You can hold your breath for twice as long, which doubles how long the air in a Void Suit or similar equipment lasts.

name: Augmetic Viscera
description: Colloquially known as a 'gut-job', this augmetic reroutes blood vessels, bypasses lymph ducts, and replaces tissues with superior vat-grown or mechanical substitutes.
effect: You gain +1 Toughness.

name: Autodogmatic Cortex
description: A small cogitator mounted on the inside of the skull feeds a constant stream of hymns, prayers, and catechisms directly into the brain to bolster faith and resolve.
effect: You gain +1 Willpower.

name: Cardioproxy
description: A biorhythmic pump and metres of sanguinary tubing replaces most of the circulatory system.
effect: You gain +1 Toughness.

name: Cortex Implant
description: A network of micro-cogitators and neural catalysts replaces a portion of the brain, correcting damage and refining thought processes.
effect: You gain +1 Intellect.

name: Mind Impulse Unit
description: Used for divine communion by adherents of the Machine Cult and to implement sabotage by sordid criminals, this augmetic allows a mortal mind to directly interface with a machine spirit.
effect: You can converse with a machine spirit as an Action; this may require a Tech (Int) Test for unruly spirits. If you succeed, you gain +Double Rank bonus dice to all Tests to operate the machine.

name: Neuroplastic Psychosectemy
description: Equal parts surgery and sacred ritual, the emotional and illogical parts of the patient's brain are excised, replaced by cogitators hardwired to the cerebral cortex.
effect: You gain +1 Intellect and +1 Willpower but suffer -2 Fellowship.

name: Reflex Catalyst
description: Conductive cabling and synaptic triggers enhance the speed of the autonomic nervous system.
effect: You gain +1 Initiative.

name: Sinew Armature
description: Joints and major muscles are replaced with actuators, tensor cables, and vat-grown tissue.
effect: You gain +1 Strength.

name: Subdermal Armour
description: Rigid metal plates and resistant fibre weaves distort and harden skin.
effect: You gain +1 Base Resilience.

name: Weapon Implant
description: Some weapons can be incorporated into augmetic replacements. You may implant a weapon with the Pistol Trait into an augmetic arm, or choose to implant a knife or a melee weapon of a similar size.
effect: You can extract or retract the implanted weapon as an Action. Your limb functions normally until you extract it. The limb can only be used as a weapon while the weapon is extracted. You can't drop an implanted weapon and you can't be disarmed without amputating the limb.

name: Eyes Of The Crone
description: These complex augmetic eyes grant Aeldari precise perception beyond the material realm, allowing them to peer through the skein of fate.
effect: A single Eye of the Crone can have two different Augmetic Eye effects.

name: Heart of Vaul
description: Implanted just above the heart, this augmetic projects a nearly invisible refractive force field perfectly contoured to the body.
effect: You gain +1 to Defence and Armour in addition to any armour or shield you have.

name: Iron Gob
description: Curved slabs of jagged ceramite are crudely bolted to an Ork's jaw, providing additional protection and an intimidating profile to an already fearsome face.
effect: You gain +1 Armour (this stacks with worn Armour) and +1 bonus die to Intimidation (Wil) Tests. You can make a melee bite attack with a Damage of 6 +2 ED.

name: Iron Gutz
description: Some Orks have appetites best described as suicidal. This implant replaces the recipient's digestive system with industrial tubing and linked chemical reaction chambers that allow the recipient to eat even the corrupted flesh of daemons.
effect: You gain +2 bonus dice to Tests to resist ingested poisons. You can automatically find food to subsist you in any environment.

name: Rebuilt Cranium
description: The effects of a rebuilt cranium are impossible to predict, as the Ork's skull and brain is replaced with adamantine plates and assorted scrap circuitry or xenos tech.
effect: Roll 1d3 at the start of each session. Your Intellect Attribute increases by the result. You may spend a point of Wrath to reroll the 1d3 at any time. The GM may force a reroll of the 1d3 under circumstances that could cause the bionik to malfunction.
